title.rendered: STAND STILL…TRY AGAIN.MOVE ON, by Boaz Olang

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“…And Moses said unto the people, Fear not, stand still, and see the salvation of the Lord, which he will show to you today: for the Egyptians (your enemies who are pursuing after you) whom you have seen today, you shall see them again no more forever. The Lord shall fight for you, and you shall hold your peace”. Exodus 14: 13-14

I want to bring to your attention, today, that life is not easy, and that your life is and will be full of trouble. No matter who you are or where you are, you will encounter moments and experiences that will leave you not knowing what to do. Have you ever said to yourself in the face of a problem or situation, “I don’t know what to do”? I have, many times. We each face times when our life is filled with fear, doubts, confusion, hopelessness, sorrow, pain, anxiety and uncertainty, exhaustion and desperation, distress and depression, and a lot more than I can catalogue here. Sometimes, we are surrounded by pain and perplexity. In addition, we wonder whether life if still what it used to be or should be. We sometimes question the love of God and even, accuse him for negligence. We sometimes ask questions like “Why has God allowed this to happen to me?’ or “What I have done or not done to deserve this?” or “Why cant I be successful or be blessed with this or that, like other people or my friends?”

Whatever your questions are or may be, I don’t have an answer, but I want to remind you or make you aware of a few facts of life that you need to know and live by, and give you some recommendation of what to do to overcome, be blessed and stay blessed.

One, understand and accept that life is full of trouble and that as a man (human being) born of woman, all your days on earth, you will face and deal with trouble. Job, one of the patriarchs of faith, who faced more problems than you can imagine understood and accepted that fact positively. Here is what he said: “Man that is born of woman is of few days, and full of trouble. He comes forth like a flower, and is cut down: He fleeth also as a shadow, and continues not”. Job 14: 1-2.

Two, understand that no effort of your own will deliver you. You need God to save you. When Israel faced the impossible Red Sea and didn’t know what to do, God, alone, intervened and instructed them what to do. He said, “Don’t move. Do not cry or try to fight. Stand still and see My salvation”. That is what they needed to do. They needed to stop crying, complaining or blaming everyone else, but themselves.

Three, understand and accept that no one’s got an easy ride in this life.  Everyone has their own share of trials, challenges or trouble. Yours is not unique nor are they special. They are only different. Even Jesus had His, and at one point wished, He could escape one of the worst and most painful experiences of His life, when He was dying on the Cross,  He felt lonely. He could not bear or endure the pain, alone. He cried “…My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?” (Mathew 27: 46). God, His Father, strengthened Him to go through that pain.It was His exit to recapture eternal glory. May be, today, you are resisting and fighting something that could be your last exit to a brand new day of victory, peace, hope, prosperity and pleasure, in the Lord. Stop fighting and stand still, instead, let go and let God. Don’t just fold your hands passively, doing nothing. Stand still in prayer, faith, hope, love, and perseverance. Listen to His instruction, and do His will. Not yours. Do your “Will Alignment” today. Align your will to His. If you don’t, you will wobble, shake, veer off the road and you may be very dangerous to yourself and others, who are around you and who depend on you or look up to you. Stand still. Will you? God will surely visit you and bring you up, and out. Blessings Boaz

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Chronicles 20:1-30, vs. 15, “… Do not be afraid nor dismayed because of this great multitude, for the battle is not yours, but Gods…”

Everyone at one point needs the hand of God in their lives whether they be believers or not, leaders or not. I see everyday how it is impossible to live in this cruel world without having God on my side. Everyday when I pray I continuously tell God that without Him, I am doomed. I look around and see many people who need the hand of God yet they do not want to admit it. Healing, deliverance, peace, joy, provisions and the like are the things people need everyday but who can provide them apart from God?

King Jehoshaphat, mark the word King at one point needed the hand of God in his life and so were the people he was leading as they faced three powerful Kingdoms coming against them. This was not a war initiated by King Jehoshaphat yet here it was. Ultimately his next move was to call on God for help when no one was around to give a helping hand. Psalms 46:1 always comes in mind when one is going through something and no one can help, “God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble”. There is power in prayer as it gives God permission to move in one’s life. So the king proclaims a prayer and fast all over his kingdom, adding fast to their prayer showed how desperate they needed God’s answer. Whenever we desperately need God’s hand in our lives, you may be moved to add fasting into your prayers. Those who are craving for God’s move will do desperate things, they will seek him fervently, earnestly, boldly, persevering, lingering etc

How amazing it is to hear the Lord say you don’t need to fight in a battle that is scheduled for you. A word comes from above telling them not to be afraid or dismayed because the battle is the Lord’s. I’m learning when I let go, He takes my hand and gently leads me and He lets me know how peaceful my life can be because He fights for me. The only times I fight the battles is when He promises me that His presence will be with me in the battlefield. When He tells me to stand still, it’s time to let go. Stand still and see the salvation of the Lord, Be still and know that I am God. Many people are not willing to let go because they don’t trust that if they let go this, they can get that and so they hold on to step one. Let go today that He may get you to step two. As the Lord fought for them, they praised Him. It’s good to bring a request before the Lord, but while you are in the waiting mode, find in your heart to thank Him in advance, praise Him like it’s already been done. What the Lord approves, it’s done even before anyone sees the results. Those who are not praising and thanking God open themselves to worrying as they constantly check to see if the Lord has already done it or not. As for these people, while they were praising and thanking God, they did not see how the Lord destroyed the enemies, all they saw was the result. At times I just need to get lost in praising and thanking Him and after it has been said and done, all I will need to do is see the results. After their enemies were destroyed, the king and his people marched to the battle ground and gathered the possessions of the enemy. They were more than conquerors that day because God conquered for them. They only desired victory over the enemy but the Lord gave them more than they asked for, Ephesians 3:20, “Now unto Him who is able to do exceeding, abundantly above all we ask or imagine according to the power that works within us”. You asked for little, He is giving you much for He is the God of abundance.

When we have called Him and it’s done, we will all be glad that we involved Him in our business for it is not by might nor by power but by my spirit says the Lord of host. Call Him in your situation today and choose this day to let go of everything you are holding onto as He is in control when things are out of control. When the enemy comes to you like a flood, the Lord will raise up a standard against him. When he shows you of what he is capable of, show him  what God is capable of and remind him of his future. Let go and let God!!Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Until You Let It Go, You Still Owe It

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Matthew 6:12,” And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtor

The ability to let go has been a struggle for many people especially when they have been wronged. If someone is to approach and ask you to let go, you stand there wondering if they really understand what the other person did to you. This is dealing with someone who has crossed the line. I am talking about forgiveness.

Based on the dictionary definition, forgiveness is an act of excusing a mistake or offense. It’s not very easy to walk to someone and excuse them when they have wronged you. At one point it was a tooth for a tooth and an eye for an eye. In other words, you received back what you gave. But we are living at a time  where we have an awesome opportunity to pardon why? because over and over again in the bible, we hear men going before God seeking forgiveness for sinning against God. vs. 14, “For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you’. Trespass is to enter onto another’s land wrongfully, so when we are offended, we see that someone has entered into our land wrongfully and has committed an offense. Such a person deserves to be brought to justice. Here is something that caught me, Jesus said, ‘forgive men their trespasses’which means that instead of bringing that person to the courts to accuse them of their offences against you, settle the issue out of court by forgiving them. No need to accuse them before God over what they did, all you need is to forgive even as your Father in heaven is always ready to forgive you. Many times we hold people so high thinking they will never fail us but the truth is, man has issues and we all have to learn not to put our confidence in man. Jesus said, ‘it’s impossible for offences not to come’, the more they come, the more we ought to learn the art of forgiveness.

There are people who cannot progress until they have let go of what they are holding onto. You could have been wronged; your key to release is to forgive. This means that the one who owes you an apology is the one you owe forgiveness. You are in debt as long as you are still holding onto unforgiveness, therefore until you let it go, you still owe it. You will not get that release until you pay that debt by releasing it. It’s not about deserving to be forgiven but about pleasing the Lord by forgiving. Isn’t it amazing that the Lord will not accept our worship and sacrifices until we have forgiven?, and that the Lord will not forgive us if we are not willing to forgive?. We don’t deserve His forgiveness, yet He forgives us and forgets. You’ve heard people say, ‘I will forgive you but not forget’, the Lord forgives and forgets. No one will ever wrong us the way we wrong the Lord, yet He is always faithful to forgive us. One thing about forgiveness is that when you let it go, a whole big load is lifted off you and your burden is lightened. Matthew 6:12,” And forgive us our debts, as we forgive our debtor’, Lord forgive us as we are in the process of forgiving those who owe us an apology. Who has wronged you, are you waiting for them to apologize before you can forgive them? Are you determined not to forgive them? have you purposed to forgive and not forget? The bible says, ‘blessed are the peacemakers’, it may not be easy but they vote for it by making peace with everyone so be one. Blessings Ev, God’s servant.

content.rendered:
Good morning,

JOB 2:3 Then the LORD said to Satan, “Have you considered my servant Job? There is no one on earth like him; he is blameless and upright, a man who fears God and shuns evil. And he still maintains his integrity, though you incited me against him to ruin him without any reason.”

What do you see the world recognizes?  Money, Fame, Power, Prestige, Talent, etc….   What are some of the things that you have been recognized for in your life?  Are they awards you’ve won, degrees you earned, positions you’ve raised too, a certain financial status that you’ve obtained?   We must realize that what we value, and what the world recognizes is certainly NOT the same as what God recognizes.  Sure almost everyone appreciates recognition for things they have done, but it’s an entirely different ball game when the God of heaven looks upon your life and measures it from his perfect perspective, which is vastly different from yours, perhaps even offensive to you.  God is not recognizing Bill Gates in heaven because of a huge earthly success and the plethora of money that he earned.  Yes, he worked hard, and did a lot of good with his products and software which most of us are probably using right now to read this devotion.

Yet in Job’s day and time, he himself was the Bill Gates.  Let me explain how this I know so from a preacher that I heard on the radio although I forget his name, his word opened my eyes even further to this man called Job. He lost all his sheep – Sheep were used to make clothing at that time to which Job had more than anyone.  When fire fell from heaven, HIS WHOLE CLOTHING LINE, before GAP, Tommy Hilfiger, Sean John, etc.., was gone.  He lost all his camels when the Chaldeans formed three raiding parties and swept down on his camels and carried them off. Camels were used to take long journeys.  Job’s TAXI CAB SERVICE WAS DESTROYED! A mighty desert wind then came in and caused the house to collapse were his sons and daughters were abiding.  THERE WENT HIS CHILDREN! And if that was not enough, Satan then afflicted Job with painful sores from the soles of his feet to the top of his head.   Then Job took a piece of broken pottery and scraped himself with it as he sat among the ashes.  JOB’S BODY WAS IN EXCRUCIATING PAIN.  This only added insult to injury or perhaps better said injury to insult.

Yet with all that Job had that God had blessed him with, God honored Job’s character not even mentioning his great wealth that he had when He spoke to Satan.  Here’s what God pointed out.

1 – There is no one like him in all the earth.  Job was many notches above the rest.  When put under a microscope his life shows what no other life can show.

2 – He is blameless and upright.  No one can find any dirt, deception, deceit, jealousy, pride, or crooked ways in his life.

3 – A man who fears God.  Job recognized that God was in charge and he so reverenced the Lord NO MATTER WHAT HAPPENED TO HIM.  It’s easy to worship God when everything is hunky-dory (great), but to fall to the ground in worship and say:   “Naked I came from my mother’s womb, and naked I will depart. The LORD gave and the LORD has taken away; may the name of the LORD be praised.” What a statement.  Most men fear other men, NOT JOB, he feared God alone.  “A man who is intimate with God is not intimidated by men”.

4 – And shuns evil.  Job’s heart, unlike most peoples heart, perhaps even yours, repelled sin and was not drawn to it like a moth to the flame.  His heart was resolved completely with the attitude “Teach me your way, O LORD, and I will walk in your truth; give me an undivided heart, that I may fear your name.”

5 – And he still maintains his integrity. Real integrity is character woven through out the fabric of your life.  It’s how you are, how you think, and what you do in the dark, when no one is looking, when no one would know.  What would you try and get away with if you knew no one would catch you?  Perhaps your answer to this will cause you to worship the Lord or confess, and get right with God.

Take a self check, inventory your life, how are you measuring up to God.  If you are a saint perhaps you are struggling with some sin that needs to GO.  If you are a sinner, then you are not yet saved, and God is angry with the sinner daily (Psalm 7:11).  What do you think God is saying right now about your character, what can he recognize in you?

Blessings,
Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“For ever, O Lord Your Word is settled in heaven.” Psalm 119:89

Here on earth people have various discrepancies with the Word of God.  Here are the thoughts of some people that don’t believe God’s Word to be the absolute truth:

    1.      I don’t believe the Bible to be God’s Word.
    2.      The Bible has been changed.
    3.      It’s just a bunch of stories.
    4.      Not everything is true in the Bible.
    5.      The Bible has contradictions.
    6.      I tried to read the Bible, but can’t understand it.
    7.      Didn’t men, NOT God, write the Bible?

    And whereas all of these statements can be easily explained in away, and please e-mail us if there is one you believe and need an answer to, or one that you would like to know so as to answer another who has or may make such a statement, these statements are never heard in heaven.

In heaven not one of these statements is ever spoken, why, “Because forever O’ Lord Your Word is settled in heaven.  Forever speaks of eternity, yet many live for the temporary.  God, and all the host of heaven (angels) and the saints present in heaven live in the eternal, spiritual realm, and are not sitting around questioning God’s Word.  No, the host of heaven and saints see plainly the Word of God.  The Apostle Paul said it like this, “Now we see but a poor reflection as in a mirror; then we shall see face to face. Now I know in part; then I shall know fully, even as I am fully known (1 Cor. 13:12).”

We do not see clearly.  Paul’s metaphor is that of the imperfect reflection seen in one of the polished metal mirrors (see James 1:23) of the ancient world in contrast with seeing the Lord face to face (see Gen 32:30; Num 12:8; 2 Cor 3:18).  We have impaired spiritual vision.  If Paul saw “a poor reflection as in a mirror,” how much more is our vision impaired?  Have you ever tried to view the world through a medal mirror, or perhaps you remember the mirrors you saw in a fun house (which brings distortion), or even seeing through a foggy mirror?  There is truly no perfect spiritual mirror here on earth, accept God’s Word.

Yet even God’s Word is not crystal clear to us.  Oh yes, we do our best being inspired by the Holy Spirit.  And the longer you diligently serve God, mature spiritually, consistently read God’s Word, learn, memorize, and meditate upon it the more you will comprehend.  But in heaven the angels and saints don’t have vision problems, they see “face to face,” and “they know fully, even as they are fully known.”  Perhaps that is why in heaven instead of theological arguments they reverently cry out “Holy, Holy, Holy is the Lord of hosts, the whole earth is filled with your glory.  Now through the Word of God, I know in part; then, in the presence of the Lord I will know fully, to the full extent that a redeemed finite human being can know and in a way similar in kind to the way the Lord in his infinite wisdom fully and infinitely knows me.  God’s glory (presence) makes everything clearly seen and makes sense perfectly.  His radiance illuminates all things in Light of Truth, and so one can only cry out holy, holy, holy.  Why is this so, because “For ever O’ Lord Your Word is settled in heaven!

Application:  How often are you reading God’s Word to settle your life in truth?  Are you right with God that you cry out holy, holy, holy, and will do the same on Judgment Day, or will you cry out when you stand before Him, “Oh no Your Word really is true? Make sure it is settled.  Amen

Blessings,
Pastor Phil <><

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Philippians 4:13, “I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me”

This verse has been quoted by many people in reference to the impossible they wanted to accomplish. A few verses that lead to verse 13 paints a different picture, and leads us to understand it’s proper application if we were to use it. Listen to Paul’s words 11-13, “Not that I speak in regards to need, for I have learned in whatever state I am, to be content: I know how to be abased, and I know how to abound. Everywhere and in all things I have learned both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to suffer need, I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me”. If you look at this scripture carefully you see a lot of learning and surviving that causes Paul to be victorious in the end.  He looks at all he had been through and was still standing and he knows it has nothing to do with him but Christ, he confidently says, “I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me” His confidence is not in his ability, it’s in whose He is.

I believe that the greater thing you can do through Christ who strengthens you is what you can survive. When you can be content with the little and trust God right where you are, be calm while others are freaking out; learn to be full and be hungry, learn to keep your coolness under frustrations, learning to share the little you have, learning to let go of things others struggle to hold on to. In short being able to deal, to stand, and be comfortable right where you are and not allow the challenges to destroy you because of Him who strengthens you. You and I can stand on this promise, I can do (go through) all things through Christ who strengthens me. Greater testimony comes from what you have survived, not what you have achieved. What you have survived has a lot to teach compared to what you have achieved. I am more grateful for the things I have survived for they were eye opening and they brought out the best in me cause I realized that if I can go through this and come out victoriously, I can go through something else because that  same God who was with me when I went through it, is the same God who will be with me when I go through this. Patience, character, integrity among others are best learnt in trying times.

I know we quote this scripture many times based on what we want to do; I would like to quote it based on what we can withstand through Him. I can imagine Paul writing this line because of what he had survived and will survive.

How I pray that just like Paul we will learn how to deal with different situations and circumstances that we may confidently quote Phil 4:13. Blessings, Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Proverbs 3:3, “Let love and faithfulness never leave you; bind them around your neck, write them on the tablet of your heart”

To continue to strengthen and encourage couples, let me share another thought in light of what I shared last Wednesday.

In looking at different passages in the bible, you find that “LOVE” and “FAITHFULNESS” are joined by the word “and”. “KINDNESS” and “FAITHFULNESS” also appears many times in the bible, these words work together. In a relationship, there can be no faithfulness without love and love cannot continue to flourish without faithfulness. They depend on each other, without one, the other would be dead. Psalm 85:10, “Love and faithfulness meet together..” They are patterned and woven together into each other. They have kissed and bonded to become one.

I would not waste time talking about “love” because if we can master “faithfulness”, we would have mastered “love”. Let’s take the word “FAITHFULNESS” and break it into two parts, “FAITH” and “FULLNESS”. The bible defines faith “as the assurance (the confirmation) of the things [we] hope for, being the proof of things [we] do not see and the conviction of their reality [faith perceiving as real fact what is not revealed to the senses (Hebrews 11:1 AMP). In a relationship, it’s taking what you see as falling and failing and believing that it’s not always bound to be the same forever therefore laboring to keep it alive and better. You don’t expect to give up on it when the going gets tough, you keep seeing something good far beyond the natural and reality. The other aspect of faith is “LOYALTY”, a choice made by an individual to keep a promise (a vow) he or she made.  “FULLNESS” is to complete, to give it maximum attention it needs. Give faith a 100% with no doubt of mind and I would term that “FAITHFULNESS”.

One of the things killing marriages today is lack of faithfulness.Faithfulness is the cornerstone of a relationship. If I was to ask couples today what they would consider the most important  thing in their marriage, I bet they would tell me “FAITHFULNESS”. Why not love, kindness, respect, support etc as first? It’s because all these are centered around the word “FAITHFULNESS”. Faithfulness involves loving your partner in ways that meet his or her needs. You will love because you are faithful, you will support because you are faithful and you will be kind because you are faithful. Faithfulness implies duty. Faithfulness begins as a choice, the reason Proverbs 3:3, tells us not to “Let love and faithfulness never leave you; bind them around your neck, write them on the tablet of your heart“. It’s the essence of a good Godly blessed marriage (relationship). We can choose to let it leave us by our words and actions. A husband or wife can feel safe knowing their spouse is faithful. Proverbs 20:28 “Love and faithfulness keep a king (queen) safe; through love his (her)  throne is made secure”.Husbands are kings of their home (throne) and wives are the queens of their home (throne), their aim is to love and be faithful to each other to keep their kingdom safe and secure. If the kingdom is not safe and secure, expect intruders which leads to unfaithfulness. How many have fell on that trap because their kingdoms were not secured by love and faithfulness? Faithfulness (trustworthy) is very fragile, once broken it’s hard to mend it. The best ways you demonstrate your faithfulness today will build bridges of trust for a life time. Being trustworthy is keeping your word. Don’t let love and faithfulness leave you if you want you marriage (relationship) to grow and flourish. Write it on the table of your heart and remind yourself everyday to keep them. Blessings Evans

NB: The last two weeks have been hard for our family but praise be to God even in the midst of our loss, God has been faithful to bring us through. content.rendered:
Good morning,

1 Corinthians 13:1-13, “4 Love suffers long and is kind; love does not envy; love does not parade itself, is not puffed up; 5 does not behave rudely, does not seek its own, is not provoked, thinks no evil; 6 does not rejoice in iniquity, but rejoices in the truth; 7 bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.  8Love never fails”.

We have safes we keep valuable stuff we don’t want anyone or anything to interfere with; they are very precious to us. My wife and I have a fire resistant safe; in it we have kept valuable things such as marriage certificate, passports, important documents and the like because we don’t want to loose them either by theft, misplacement and or fire. Now a fire-resistant safe is a type of safe that is designed to protect its contents from high temperatures or actual fire. Fire resistant safes are usually rated by the amount of time they can withstand the extreme temperatures a fire produces, while not exceeding a set internal temperature

And so are marriages, there are qualities that must be put in a safe because they are precious to you and unless your safe is built with fire resistant materials, it’s bound to suffer when fire comes. Proverbs 4:23, “Keep your heart with all diligence, For out of it spring the issues of life”.  Don’t we hear people say, “follow your heart”, but the heart is deceitful, it wants things for itself, we are told “to keep it with all diligence”.  Unguarded heart is a heart that may not survive the heat that come from the fire of life even in a marriage but a heart that is surrendered to God is a heart that has been placed in a safe, Matthew 6:21, “For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also”. To “follow your heart” is setting yourself for disaster, you ought to “lead your heart” not follow it.

There’s a quote from the movie (Fireproof), Lt. Michael Simmons says,“Fireproof doesn’t mean the fire will never come, it means when the fire comes that you will be able to withstand it”, I believe many marriages been exposed, hearts left unattended, the things that should have been guarded have been left in the open and the enemy knows how to take what is left exposed and set it on fire. His mission is simple inJohn 10:10 The thief does not come except to steal, and to kill, and to destroy”. He parades to you that you are better than the current situation that you deserve better, that you cannot waste your life. All he wants to do and he has done many times to other people is to let people think about themselves. Marriages have been viewed by many as, “what’s in it for me??” and that is the driving force for love. Look at what Paul says love is NOT, “love does not parade itself, is not puffed up; 5does not behave rudely, does not seek its own, is not provoked, thinks no evil; 6 does not rejoice in iniquity”, in other words, these are NOT the things you and your spouse should keep in your fire resistant safe, if you do, they will be destroyed from the inside. So true love is not what it gets but what it gives, but you cannot give what you’ve not guarded in the safe. These are the qualities you and your spouse ought to safeguard, protect, nature, at all cost because fire will come against them, remember Love suffers long and is kind, love rejoices in the truth,(God’s word); 7 bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things.  8 Love never fails”.

Fires of financial challenges will come, parasites inform of people, health challenges, misunderstandings, disagreements, be sure you have what is valuable in your marriage to withstand the fire when it comes, Lead your heart to true love as defined by God and not by the world’s definition. Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Genesis 39:33, 38,41, “Now therefore, let Pharaoh select a discerning wise man, and set him over the land of Egypt”…And Pharaoh said to his servants, “Can we find such a one as this, a man in who is the Spirit of God?”…And Pharaoh said to Joseph, “See, I have set you over all the land of Egypt”

One man was asked how he makes elephant sculptures off a tree trunk, his response was , “I take the tree trunk, chop off  what does not look like an elephant and what I will be left with will be an elephant. Thereafter I refine that elephant to bring to a completion what I had in mind when I thought of making it”. I have read somewhere that “leaders are not born but are made”. One of our mission statements at church is to raise leaders. Leaders are few because we have so many followers. In as much as so many people don’t feel they are leaders or have the qualities of leadership in them, what they need is to have everything chopped off them that does not make them look like a leader and what they will be left with is what they need to be one.

I believe that all of us have qualities of leadership. It may not be for a big corporation or group but a leader just over a person. What will take for that to happen is first determining who you are, where you are, where you want to go. Getting into conditions that will boost you to your destination. To bring a mental picture, look at an egg, if a chicken is expected out of that egg, then number one: it has to be put under certain temperatures which will lead to incubation and when it’s time is due, the  chick will then fight it’s way out of the shell. Remember that it had to be given the right conditions to develop from being an egg to being a chick. As long as it’s just a yolk, nothing will happen but when it matures into a chick, the shell is no longer its dwelling place. This mental picture shows me that we have the qualities of being leaders whether we know it or not, all that is needed is to be in a right incubator. It’s okay to be an egg but when you know that you have the ability to be more than an egg, you will not be comfortable being one. You will desire to fight your way through. Often times a word that lingers within our hearts and mind is “I CAN’T”, that’s good because you just passed the test and now you can be made one. Just because you can’t do it doesn’t mean it can’t be done.

Joseph was a leader developed, for a while he was in an incubator of life being developed to be one. When he was but a young man, he was to me like an egg, comfortable being one but when he dreamt twice, the dreams triggered and awakened something inside of him reminding him he wasn’t all the Father wanted him to be. From making the mistake of bragging about how his household will bow before him, to being sold into Egypt, to being in Potiphar’s house, to being in jail to finally rising to power, I can see every part of his leadership being developed. Joseph being developed to be a leader recognized the leadership of someone else above him and he yielded to that leadership, he was first under the leadership of Potiphar and then Pharaoh. He was a man in authority and under authority, through his struggle in life, God developed the humility in him, a quality of a leader.

A servant’s heart is a required quality, this does not just come, it’s developed through a pattern of life. Mark 9:35, “And He sat down, called the twelve, and said to them, “If anyone desires to be first, he shall be last of all and servant of all“. Being a leader is not about bossing people around but leading by example, this has to be developed. Jesus was not a bossy leader but one that led by example. Doing what many leaders of today would not do, being a servant of all. Joseph learnt servant hood through serving his brothers, Portiphar, the people in prison, the people of Egypt and his own. Wisdom was one of his leadership qualities, again we can see how foolish he was in the beginning but in due time, what was inside of him was developed to maturity. His interpretation of the dream to giving the advice on what was to be done was a God given developed quality the Egyptians needed.

You can see that it took time to develop his leadership skills but he was ready for it, he knew of his limitations but did not limit God. He may have not understood the leadership class he was taking but I believe he appreciated it in life because God put him in an incubator. That egg, the thing that was delicate, that which could not move, that which could not function beyond, and that which was small had to be awakened to push its way out to become more than just an egg. Do you see yourself as more than an egg? it’s okay to be an egg but not bound to stay an egg forever. There are so many things in you that have not materialized yet, you need to be in an incubator. Ask God to show you what you could be as a leader and let that trigger something inside of you to desire to be one. Blessings Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Job 42:5, “I have heard of You by the hearing of the ear, But now my eye sees You”

All his life, Job had learned to trust in the Lord, praying to Him, living for Him, leading his family in the things of God, But in the storm Job saw God. Having questioned God, God turns around and gives him 101 questions that leave him thinking and humbles him the most.

Through God’s questions to Job, Job had a new awareness of the wisdom of God’s hidden plans, a new sense of awe of His greatness and shows him his limitations even in the midst of the storm. In the midst of the storm, He appeared unto Job. At last Job understood God whom he had seen through the eyes of faith. No one who has seen the Lord in the storm can remain the same; it either breaks you or makes you.

Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-Nego were thrown into the fire and in the midst of their storm, the Son of God revealed Himself in that fire and they felt comfortable in the fire though their situation did not change. It was amazing to for them to see the Lord they had believed in, walked with, and lived for manifest Himself in their situation. So was Stephen just when he was about to be  stoned, and Stephen in Acts 7: 55…, being full of the Holy Spirit, gazed into heaven and saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God, 56 and said, “Look! I see the heavens opened and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God!” Oh how we would desire to see the Lord right in the midst of the challenges that we are in.

You too might question the Lord as to why things are happening the way they are happening. We need to remember God’s word that says Isaiah 55: 8 “For My thoughts are not your thoughts, Nor are your ways My ways,” says the LORD.  9 “For as the heavens are higher than the earth, So are My ways higher than your ways, And My thoughts than your thoughts”. At the beginning it may not make sense but as we trust and yield to Him then we will move from just hearing about the Lord and what He has done to actually see Him before our very own eyes by faith. He is the fourth man revealed in the fire in Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-Nego’s story. It appears that there would have not been a better way for Job to see God but while in the midst of his fire storm. He had never so well grasped the greatness, majesty, sovereignty, and independence of God as he did at that moment.

If I can’t understand what is happening and why it’s happening, I pray that we can believe that He knows where we are and where we are going.  You may have been praying for change in a situation and it doesn’t seam like its happening, in fact it’s getting even worse. Let your prayer be, “may I see You the way Job, Stephen, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-Nego did in what would be considered a painful hellish situation” His presence alone in the midst of it changes us completely and is enough to carry us through the storm, His presence brings about Joy and peace in the midst of it. 1John 3:2, “Beloved, now we are children of God; and it has not yet been revealed what we shall be, but we know that when He is revealed, we shall be like Him, for we shall see Him as He is”Therefore, as we are sanctified by faith, we must be sanctified by hope. That we may be saved by hope and be purified by it. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Faith Book/Face Book, by Susanne Scheppmann, Submitted by Maria Chilkuri

content.rendered:
Good morning,
This devo was sent to me by Maria and thought of sharing it with you. this shows how even good things can be a distraction, distracting us from what ought to be our priority. let this be a challenge to us all not just with facebook but other things that take our time from what is important. Be blessed Ev.
“They stood where they were and read from the Book of the Law of the Lord their God for a quarter of the day, and spent another quarter in confession and in worshiping the Lord their God.” Nehemiah 9:3 (NIV)
A new addiction slipped into my life recently – Facebook.  Internet social networking slid in quietly and unobtrusively.  Each day I found myself reading and posting a bit more.  I learned how to create my visual bookshelf, so my “friends” could check out what I was reading.  I linked my blog.  My time seeped into Facebook like grains of sand slide through the hourglass.
My addiction soon took a turn for the worst.  I began to put off my personal quiet time with God until after I had Facebooked.  Sadly, scripture seemed boring next to my friends’ postings. Strangely, the mundane posts intrigued me.  I had fallen under the spell of social networking.
Then one day, I dragged myself away from my laptop.  I had Bible study that night and needed to finish my lesson.  The lesson pointed us to the book of Nehemiah.  I read, “They stood where they were and read from the Book of the Law of the Lord their God for a quarter of the day, and spent another quarter in confession and in worshiping the Lord their God.” (Nehemiah 9:3, NIV).
Yikes! They read God’s Word for a quarter of the day, then spent another quarter of the day in confession and worshiping?  These words haunted me the rest of the afternoon.  When was the last time I spent that much time with God?  How much time did I spend on the Internet?  I felt a deep conviction about my Facebook addiction.
I determined that day to read my Bible, my FaithBook, before I turned on my computer each day.  I would network with God, before networking with my friends.  When I made this decision, I saw scripture jump back to life.  God’s Word spoke to me with a freshness that seemed as if He had just posted it Himself.
The addiction stopped.  Oh, I still enjoy Facebook and other social networks, but I have learned to keep them in proper perspective.  Psalm 119:59-60 sums up my new intent: “I pondered the direction of my life, and I turned to follow your laws.  I will hurry, without delay, to obey your commands” (NLT).
Will you join me in the commitment to spending time in God’s Word before time spent on Facebook?
Dear Lord, I recognize that I spend too much time on the computer.  Forgive my inattention to Your Word.  Help me each day to place You first in my life.  In Jesus’ Name, Amen.

content.rendered:
Good morning

Romans 10:17, “So then faith comes by hearing, and hearing by the word of God”

Commercials are one of the greatest tools the manufacturers use to convey messages of their new products. Millions of dollars are poured into commercials to create awareness of the latest products. The commercials are supposed to be catchy and sometimes funny, some with twisted humor. Why do people go for things they go for? either someone told them about it and were convinced it works or saw it on TV, heard it on radio, bill boards, news papers. The product will not do them good if they don’t try it. For a fact, most commercials exaggerate what their products can do only to discover it’s ability to work for a short time and it’s effectiveness is gone.

We have talked about faith so many times but let this help build your faith. Faith is the confident belief in the truth, value, and worthiness of a person, idea or a thing. It’s being loyal to a person or a thing. If you were to tell me your name, I must have faith to believe you told me the truth. If I said, “I don’t believe you”, chances are, you will be offended because I am insinuating you are deceiving me, the same way  if you told me where you live and I told you I doubt it, you will not take it kindly. Hebrews 11:6, says “For without faith it is impossible to please God…”. You want to please God, you  have to have faith, believing what He has said without doubting. Doubt is an indication of mistrust, and what an insult it is to God. He has displayed his products to us inform of creation, life, blessings over again therefore He is God who can be trusted, have faith in Him.

Faith is commitment. When the bible talks about FAITHFUL servant, it refers to one who is committed to a task because he has believed the one who authored the task. It’s away to build more faith because the person whom you hang around for long, their character is displayed, you have a better way of dealing with them when it comes to faith. It’s evident that you have no faith in some people, you cannot trust them with things like information or finances, they have no character to support that trust. Thanks be to God who is faithful, never leaks your information to someone else, and does not mess with what you have trusted Him with. The children of God are people of faith, committed to this walk of life with Christ, 2Corinthians 5:7, “For we walk by faith and not by sight“. It’s a tough one but we are determined to ride it out because we want to please Him.

He that uses the product must first believe that it works and what is the testimony? I don’t think faith just appears from nowhere and we believe it. It comes by hearing, hearing someone’s testimony that God can, hearing the word that drills through the nutshell of doubt and unbelief. The continuous word spoken goes around that shell and melts it down allowing it to have a new masterFAITH (Forever All In Thy Hand). You can only come to someone because you know they have it, Christ does have it forever in His hands. Doubt is the enemy of faith and it comes easily, but faith needs a lot of force to occupy. Faith is gradual concurring one step at a time depending on what it’s given to feed on. We have established what faith comes by, “Hearing“, this presents a little problem because you could hear things but wrong things and for sure those can also build faith but only towards the wrong things. “It comes by hearing by the word of God“. God’s word is like the commercial that we see out there, the only difference is that His word is not exaggerated, nothing can be added to it and nothing can be taken away from it. It presents it self, defends it self and also proves itself. It never fails, it does not work for a season, and it works always. It does not fall short of anything and it does not return void. What it starts, it will accomplish.  It’s committed through the author to accomplish what it’s meant for.. Don’t forget that faith draws a man to God. Having faith in someone whom you know cannot do it is being unwise. There is nothing impossible with Him, He is the “..author and the finisher of our faith…” Hebrews 12:2, for, Hebrews 11:6,”…He that comes to God must first believe that He is and that He is a rewarder of them that diligently seek Him“. Let your faith be boosted because you have heard the word of God. Blessings Evans

title.rendered: Closer To The Father, By Jimmy Olang

content.rendered:
Good morning,

My brother Jimmy (my immediate follower) will share devotions today, a message he had shared with our team in 2004 and is appropriate for today. be blessed. Ev

In life today, there are many people looking to find love, a sense of worth and a place to belong. People are looking for that one person who will make them feel special, loved and close. When we first meet someone, we are so in love. Nothing else seems to matter. All we think about is that person and wanting to spend every single moment with them. Sometimes these are true genuine feeling which only grows stronger with time, while other times they are just infatuation or temporary emotions that fade away after the immediate gratification is satisfied. True love is the Kind that grows stronger with time, not excitement for the moment. There is no way that a relationship can grow without spending time with the one you love. It is that feeling of closeness that makes someone feel loved, wanted and appreciated. Because when you are with that person, you feel safe, and un afraid to open up or give yourself totally without holding back.

And so it is between us and God. When we first got saved, we were so excited. We wanted nothing more than just spending time with God, reading the bible, praying, and constantly telling others of our new found relationship with Christ. But what happens after a while? Some of us “burn out”. We don’t feel as passionate as we did in the beginning, while others hold on and grow stronger. The key to a successful relationship is spending time with your partner and knowing each other’s needs and desires. It is saying I’m sorry when you are wrong, rather than being defensive. It is saying that I love you when you don’t feel like you are in “the mood” to say it. It is holding on when the storms rage, rather than packing up your bags and leave.

When David sinned with Bathsheba, and the prophet confronted him, he didn’t begin by giving excuses to justify his actions. He immediately acknowledged his sin. He knew that his relationship with God was not where he wanted it to be. They were having issues. But David didn’t do what many of us do today in our relationships. Many of us point fingers. We withdraw and build walls. We pack and leave. We look for other boyfriends and girl friends. But David didn’t pack up and leave. He didn’t try to find another God. He didn’t choose to withdraw and avoid the issue. He says in Psalms,51:3, “For I know my transgressions, and my sin is always before me. Against you only have I sinned and done what is evil in your sight.” You see David realized that to make up with God, he had to realize that he had done wrong, (which was the first step), Then he realized where he wanted to be, (which is the second step) then he took a step to fix things, (which was the third step). He then asked God for forgiveness. In verse 7, he says, “Cleanse me with hyssop, and I will be clean. Wash me and I will be white as snow. Hide your face from my sins and blot out my iniquity.” then he goes to pray one of the most powerful prayers of repentance in the bible. he says, “create in me a clean heart oh God, and renew a right spirit within me. Cast me not a way from your presence. Take not thy Holy Spirit from me. Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation and grant me a willing spirit to sustain me”. Sometimes when we have fights in our relationships, we tend to withdraw. we feel like the joy is gone. That closeness tends to fade away. But God wants different of us. He wants us to spend time with him. He wants us to love Him no matter what, because that’s the same way He loves us. If God was to withdraw from us every time we did Him wrong, He would be so far away from us and we wouldn’t feel His love. He wants to have fellowship with us. His arms are always wide stretched waiting to embrace us, but we have to take the step of reaching out to Him. We are responsible for being wherever we want to be in Christ. we have to want it so badly that we wont let anything mess our focus. James 4:8 says, “draw near to God, and he will draw near to you” If you truly want to experience that ultimate closeness with God and be at the peak of your love life with Him, we must realize that we are not where we want to be, then we must want to be where he wants us to be, then we must take action and head towards our goal. When you love someone, – Let me rephrase, “When you truly love someone, you stop at nothing to let that love manifest. When you truly love someone, nothing can separate you from them. Neither trials, nor pain, tribulations or challenges, storms or death can separate us from the love of God which is in Christ Jesus. If God went to the extend of giving up His son to prove how much He loves us, How much and how far are we willing to go to prove that we love Him??? By Jimmy Olang

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mathew 13:24-30, “…The Kingdom of heaven is likened unto a man which sowed good seeds in his field: but while men slept, his enemy came and sowed tares among the wheat, and went his way”

The bible likens the Kingdom of God to a sower who sowed good seeds in his field. The gospel is the good seed that was sowed in us through repentance and faith. The gospel (good news, good seed) was sowed in well prepared fields. Everything was okay as he natured his seed, dug around it, watered it and watched over it. This is how a Christian life ought to be, a life of hard work. Acts 14:22 “…strengthening the souls of the disciples, exhorting them to continue in the faith, and saying, “We must through many tribulations enter the kingdom of God.” Following Christ is hard work.

Proverb 4:23, “Keep thy heart with all diligence for out of it are the issues of life”, In the process of time, the sower fell a sleep and stopped watching over his sowed seeds. If we were to look at it in this day and age, he stopped praying, stopped reading the word, stopped going to church and mixing up with believers. He took off the whole armor of God, threw down his sword, and stopped fighting sin. The enemy came in and planted doubt, fear, hatred, confusion, lack of patience and many things. We are told to keep our hearts with all diligence meaning guard our heart at all times for it’s is where the issues of life flow. We are told to protect the seed at all cost, fight for the seed, so as not to allow the enemy to plant weeds in our lives. While Jesus was in the garden praying with His disciples shortly before He was arrested, He comes and finds them asleep instead of watching and praying, Luke 22:45 When He rose up from prayer, and had come to His disciples, He found them sleeping from sorrow. 46 Then He said to them, “Why do you sleep?Rise and pray, lest you enter into temptation.”

Philippians 2:12,”Therefore, my beloved, as you have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling;” It concerns us above all things to secure the welfare of our souls: whatever becomes of other things, let us take care of our best interests. We must not only work at our salvation, by doing something now and then about it; but we must work out our salvation, by doing all that is to be done, and persevering therein to the end.  Though we must use our utmost endeavors in working out our salvation, yet still we must go forth, and go on, in a dependence upon the grace of God. His grace works in us in a way suitable to our natures, and in concurrence with our endeavors; and the operations of God’s grace in us are so far from excusing, that they are intended to quicken and engage our endeavors. All our working depends upon his working in us.

Have you been guarding the seed like you should or are you sleeping on the job? You sleep and the enemy would be running the show. The sleep does not just happen, it starts with something small like sitting down, before you know it, you are way gone. It’s very hard to tell when you went to sleep but the good thing is that we can wake up from the sleep.Hebrews 12:1, “The night is far spent and the day is at hand: let us therefore cast aside the works of darkness and let us put on the armor or light“. You and I have a job to do, watch and pray. No more sleeping on the job. Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Deuteronomy 29:29, “The secret things belong to the LORD our God, but those things which are revealed belong to us and to our children forever, that we may do all the words of this law.

The way we deal with men at times tends to make us want to deal with God the same way. The way we are treated by men is the same way we think God is going to treat us. If we are failed by men we somehow feel that God might do the same. We always need to remember that God is not like any of us, His ways are not our ways and His thoughts are not our thoughts, as high as the heaven is from the earth so are His ways and His thoughts. If you have been in an airplane you see how far the ground is while you are up in the air and still you are not even close to where heaven is. This is how we are shown that God is not like us, not even close. His wisdom is unsearchable, who can understand God? whose mind can contain the thought of who God is? Who can explain His existence? No one else is like Him.

Why is it that we feel like God owes us an explanation? What makes us think that even if He was to explain Himself we would understand? our mind capacity cannot register the explanation. Why feel like God is hiding something from us that we should know so we want to discover it? It all started in the garden of Eden, Adam and Eve were told everything they needed to know about the trees in the garden but curiosity led them to want to discover more. They were instructed not to touch the tree in the middle of the garden or they would die. Here comes the serpent who brought another message to Eve and gave her an impression that the Lord God Almighty was not completely honest with them, infact He was hiding what she felt should have been something reveled to them,Genesis 3:4, Then the serpent said to the woman, “You will not surely die. 5, For God knows that in the day you eat of it your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil.” Can’t understand why man wants to try and discover or uncover what he feels is not revealed. In the process of being deceived like Eve, you find that you’ve opened yourself to lies that will eventually kill you. Human beings want to be like God whether they admit it or not. I am utterly convinced that the Bible is the book that has everything God needed to reveal to mankind. Yes there are so many things that are not recorded in the bible but everything that God needed us to know is right there. His secrets that belonged to Him have been revealed that they belong to us and our children. John 21:25, “And there are also many other things that Jesus did, which if they were written one by one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that would be written. Amen.”

Already there are many who are trying to reveal what they believe is not told in the Holy Scriptures and already many are being deceived as to questioning the word of God. If it’s not reveled to you in the Holy Scriptures don’t even try to dig into it cause you will be trying to add to the word of God or extract from His word. I want the Lord to reveal to me what I NEED TO KNOW and NOT DIG WHAT I THINK I SHOULD KNOW. He is the one who has taken time to reveal to us the secret things we should know. Psalm 37:4, “Delight yourself also in the Lord, and He shall give you the desires of your heart“, if we can master the act of delighting ourselves in Him, the secret things He has always had in His warehouse for us will be reveled to become our desires and to our children. I am safe knowing that I can delight myself in Him as He reveals what He has purposed for me to know and have. Jesus came to fulfill what was written on the books without adding or subtracting,Hebrews 10:7, “Then I said, “Behold, I have come– In the volume of the book it is written of Me– To do Your will, O God“. Be careful as to what reading materials you expose yourself too, don’t be like Eve who was deceived, check it out to make sure it’s in line with God’s word then act on what is revealed for you. Blessings, Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1 Timothy 6:17, “Command those who are rich in this present age not to be haughty, nor to trust in uncertain riches but in the living God, who gives us richly all things to enjoy.

We serve a God of too much do you know that? The God who is out to bless His children far beyond what they could ever imagine or think. He has not reserved the blessing for some people but to everyone. I am fascinated by the fact that God has blessings for everyone, He has not withheld any blessing from anyone, what troubles me is people. See when God begins to bless you and take you places, you don’t have a problem with God but have a problem with people because people have a problem with you being blessed by God. This is not new, in the book of Genesis, the first murder occurred because someone was blessed. As long as Abel had not won the attention and the affection of God, Cain was alright, the moment Abel was blessed, Cain had an attitude with him. There was nothing in him to trigger jealousy and hatred for his brother until the blessing was bestowed on Abel. Cain takes his jealousy and frustrations and dumps it on his brother by taking his life. I saw this with Saul and David, as long as David had not won the attention of God and God in turn God blessed him, Saul was ok but the moment God began to bless David, Saul was out to take his life. What about when Jesus was born, king Herod heard Jesus king of the Jews was born. A little tiny baby was already a king  being worshipped. The three shepherds were led of by the star to the place where a king who did not even have a throne here on earth was worshiped. Upon hearing all these, king Herod was out to destroy Jesus. All these three (Abel, David, Jesus) had something in common, “Blessed of God”

Where I’m I going with this? When God begin to bless don’t expect to be liked and well received by everyone. Blessings in your life are enough to trigger jealousy and hatred from some people. I hate to say this but I see this mostly among Christians. Christians who desire to see you blessed of God, they even talk about it and the moment God begins to bless you, they begin to give you attitude. They will try to assassinate your blessings, say things to make you feel guilty about being blessed, lie on you, trying by all means to put you down, saying things to kill your spirit then the blessing that you were suppose to enjoy, becomes a curse. People’s comments pierce you deep within, you try to explain yourself, you even try to hide the blessing or if revealed, you want to act like it is nothing for example, someone looks at a material thing God has blessed you with and says something nice about it and what do you do, you degrade the blessing by saying, it’s nothing, it was just a cheap, simple thing. Why are we afraid to enjoy God’s blessings? Hasn’t the bible said, “the living God gives us richly all things to enjoy?” Good family, good job, beautiful wife, handsome husband, well behaved children, blessed ministry, nice home, nice car (all things to enjoy) . If a person has a problem with you being blessed, ask them not take their frustrations on you but on God who blessed you. Why would you want to forfeit your blessing because of someone else actions? Why should you get people’s approvals before you enjoy God’s blessings? After all God will not check with anyone if He should bless you. Those who are frustrated with you right know nothing about your history. They don’t know what you went through to get where you are, the mountains you had to climb, the valleys of the shadow of death you had to pass through. The days you would sit and wonder whether God had even a blessing for you. The days you felt like giving up, sat down and just cried your eyes out. Now that you are blessed of God, why should you continue to feel bad because someone has a problem with God blessing you? You and I need ask ourselves this question, “CAN WE STAND TO BE BLESSED?”. Can you stand to ride above what people say or think when you are blessed? Many people’s blessings are turning out to be curses because they have allowed people to make them feel bad about being blessed. It’s not people’s attitude that will cause God to bless you more, it’s your attitude towards the blessing. It’s how you respond and act upon it. 2 Corinthians 1:20, “For all the promises of God in Him are Yes, and in Him Amen, to the glory of God through us”. Because God has promised to bless me and I am blessed, I refuse to act like I am not blessed and I refuse to let anyone make me feel bad about being blessed, I want to survive being blessed because he has given me all these blessings to enjoy. If I wait till everyone likes me to enjoy the blessings, I will waste everyday and I won’t be surprised if God stops blessing me. I enjoy His blessings, He gets all the glory we call it a deal. Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Hebrews 6:9-19, “And so, after he had patiently endured, he obtained the promise”

I’m back from vacation, my wife and I celebrated our third wedding anniversary on July 01, praise God. Hope you are all well. Let’s get to the word.

In a fast paced world, patience is one of the challenges we are faced to deal with. Who wants to be delayed in anything? For example, you leave the house, may be running late only to hit heavy traffic or come to a red light and it’s taking forever to turn green. You feel your patience is tested. Customers, kids, colleagues, and different situations are other things that test our patience. Besides those who are testing our patience, what we desire requires patience. Most people I meet say patience is not in their vocabulary.

Patience is not taught in a classroom; it is taught and mastered in the sea of life. A dangerous prayer one can make is, “God make me patient”, it’s a prayer for those who know the end result but do not know the process but are willing to stick it out. What happens when you are dealing with something that requires patience, if you are like me, you may try to find an alternative. If there is traffic, it’s easy to try and find alternative routes. The problem I found is that, I got more lost and took even longer to reach my destination. Some things looked familiar as I made the choice only to find I was going further and further away from my destination. When God is teaching us patience, the test comes always as an open book test. If you fail the test, you can take it again and again.  What does this tell us, God is very patient with His children. Can you imagine a teacher giving an open book test, all the answers are there but the student keeps failing the test? After a while his or her patience will run out but God is ever patient with us. He was patient with the Israelites who complained and murmured, He was patient with Gideon who kept on asking for a sign. He was patient with David who was weak in the flesh, He was very patient with Peter who kept on messing up things. He who invented patience knows how to be patient.  Faith goes with patience.

The writer of Hebrews recalls  how Abraham had hope and patience to inherit the promises of God. He is encouraging us to do what some people like Abraham did before the promise was fulfilled, Hebrews 6:11&12, “And we desire that each one of you show the same diligence to the full assurance of hope until the end, that you do not become sluggish, but imitate those who through faith and patience inherit the promises“. Some of these people are the open books to teach us how to endure through faith till the promise comes. Their promises are the result of their faith and patience. And out our attitude should be, 搃f they did it, we too can do it by God’s grace? Everyone has a dream, promises, desires, some of them have to come to pass but there are some that have not. In the valley of decision calls for an action, “should I stay on this road I already know of, wait patiently to receive the promise or should I take a back road hoping to lead me there? Abraham took the road God had set for him, there were a lot of traffic and I bet many times he thought of taking the back roads as the traffic was not moving but faith kept him on that road. Hebrews 10:35&36, “Cast not therefore your confidence with has great recompense of reward. For you are in need of patience that after you have done the will of God, you might receive the promise”. The key to fulfilling the promise is sticking with the will of God in a situation till the end. Your confidence and my confidence in Christ has great reward because when we have confidence in someone that they can and will do it, regardless of when they do it. Patience is a must to every wise man, we need it. “Want” is not the word that goes with patience only “NEED” which teaches me to be in the will of God gearing me to the promise. In the end when you look back you begin to see why patience was a must in your journey to the promise. In the valley of decision though hard, I will stick to the road He set for me. I will be tempted to take the back roads but I will learn to stay on the main road. He is patient therefore He will help me be patient. If I fail, I can take the test again, I will utilize the open book in the valley of decision. After we have done the will of God… Blessings Evans

title.rendered: What It Means To Love, by Jeff Hodge

content.rendered:
Good morning,

It gives me great pleasure to have Jeff share devotions with us. Jeff is a new believer, a gym manager I met 2 years ago, at some point I gathered courage to share the gospel with him. The first time the gospel kind of left a bad taste but God gave me another chance to share the same message with him and this time it captured his heart, repented of his sins, trusted in the Lord and has been walking with the Lord since then. He loves the Lord and loves to talk about His word. We’ve become good friends, we share every Thursdays with another new believer and a friend Casey who God brought in my life at the right time to help me do ministry at work. Be blessed as Jeff shares today. Below is his message. Blessings Ev

Sometimes it is hard and does not make sense to me that you should love your enemies, sinners and those that do wrong unto you.    My reading the bible today helps me understand what Jesus wants.

Luke 7: 39 <http://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/Luke–7-39/> Now when the Pharisee which had bidden him saw [it], he spake within himself, saying, This man, if he were a prophet, would have known who and what manner of woman [this is] that toucheth him: for she is a sinner. 40<http://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/Luke–7-40/> And Jesus answering said unto him, Simon, I have somewhat to say unto thee. And he saith, Master, say on. 41 <http://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/Luke–7-41/> There was a certain creditor which had two debtors: the one owed five hundred pence, and the other fifty. 42 <http://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/Luke–7-42/> And whenthey had nothing to pay, he frankly forgave them both. Tell me therefore, which of them will love him most? 43<http://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/Luke–7-43/> Simon answered and said, I suppose that [he], to whom he forgave most. And he said unto him, Thou hast rightly judged.

Luke 7:39 is an example of how Jesus loves us all.  He forgives us of all our sins and has paid our debt.  It amazes me how He loves me today as I grow in seeing how unworthy I am.  My debt is huge and so is my love for the Savior.  The woman in this story has great love for Christ and is at His feet washing and kissing them with her hair and tears.  We all get caught inseparating ourselves and feeling pity on sinners.  We think they aren’t worthy for any love and they deserve nothing.  But Christ shows us here that the sinner has a lot of love for the one that forgives them.

Luke 6: 27 <http://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/Luke–6-27/> But I say unto you which hear, Love your enemies, do good to them which hate you,28 <http://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/Luke–6-28/> Bless them that curse you, and pray for them which despitefully use you. 29<http://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/Luke–6-29/> And unto him that smiteth thee on the [one] cheek offer also the other; and him that taketh away thy cloke forbid not [to take thy] coat also. 30 <http://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/Luke–6-30/> Give to every man that asketh of thee; and of him that taketh away thy goods ask [them] not again. 31 <http://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/Luke–6-31/> And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise. 32 <http://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/Luke–6-32/> For if ye love them which love you, what thank have ye? for sinners also love those that love them. 33<http://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/Luke–6-33/> And if ye do good to them which do good to you, what thank have ye? for sinners also do even the same. 34 <http://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/Luke–6-34/> And if ye lend [to them] of whom ye hope to receive, what thank have ye? for sinners also lend to sinners, to receive as much again. 35<http://www.kingjamesbibleonline.org/Luke–6-35/> But love ye your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing again; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be the children of the Highest: for he is kind unto the unthankful and [to] the evil.

Love

Jeff Hodge,

Senior Program Manager

GE Capital Fitness Center

title.rendered: Dead To Self And Alive Unto Christ

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Corinthians 5:14 For the love of Christ compels us, because we judge thus: that if One died for all, then all died; 15 and He died for all, that those who live should live no longer for themselves, but for Him who died for them and rose again.

This is a kind of message you don’t hear much of Amen on but need to be heard more often. I think that many are loosing sight of the reason we serve Christ, it’s not about us but about Him. God is not a means to any one’s end, He is the glorious end. To quote Dr. Michael Horton oh now many Christians view Jesus Christ, they view him as ” …a coach with good game plan to our victory rather than a Savior who already achieved it for us“. He died for all then all died that we now should no longer live for ourselves but for Him. To quote again Dr. Horton on how people view God, “God is used as personal resource rather that known, worshiped and trusted“. There are things that drove Paul to live for God the way he did and had nothing to do with living his best life now.

When the disciples preached the love of God, they did not say “Jesus loves you”, they preached Christ crucified, Romans 5:8, “But God demonstrates His own love towards us, in that while we were still sinners, Christ died for us”, anyone who carried the cross was not coming back and we who now carry the cross are too not coming back. Christ’s loving, substitutionary death motivated and compelled Paul’s service for Him. Paul emphasized the strength of his desire to offer his life to the Lord. Christ demonstration of His love to the point of death was a driving force unto Paul to serve Christ to the point of death. He says, “If One died for all, then all died, and He died for all, that those who live should live no longer for themselves, but for Him, who died for them and rose again”. Christ died for all who died in Him.

As he defended his integrity to the Corinthians, Paul wanted them to know that his old, self-centered life was finished and that he had an all-out desire to live righteously. For all genuine believers, their death in Christ is not only a death to sin, but also a resurrection to a new life of righteousness. And the life of righteousness is not to please self but to please God.

Matthew 16:24 Then Jesus said to His disciples, “If anyone desires to come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow Me. 25For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake will find it. Galatians 2:20, I have been crucified with Christ; it is no longer I who live, but Christ lives in me; and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me and gave Himself for me.

The journey in Christ is a journey of SELF DENIAL and not SELF FULFILLMENT and Paul demonstrates it over and over again.  What we ought to ask ourselves as we walk this walk, what drives us to serve Him? Let’s make sure the motive is right, die to self and alive in Him; no longer living for self but for Him. Blessings Ev

Thanks
Ev

title.rendered: Reaching One for Christ, Part 2 by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“So Philip ran to him, and heard him reading the prophet Isaiah, and said, “Do you understand what you are reading?” ﻿31﻿ And he said, “How can I, unless someone guides me?” And he asked Philip to come up and sit with him (Acts 8”30-31).”

Explain the Word of God to them.  Philip explained the Word of God to him.  As a physical eunuch, he would have been denied access to the temple (Deut. 23:1).  If this man was to be reached with the gospel it would have to be outside the temple, which is the plan which God set up, using His servant Philip for this man.  Isn’t it great that God does not dwell in buildings made with human hands. Philip didn’t run to the chariot and then decide to abandon his evangelistic mission.  He was determined to be a faithful ambassador as Paul wrote, “Now then, we are﻿﻿ambassadors for Christ, as though God were pleading through us: we implore you on Christ’s behalf, be reconciled to God.”  How did Philip know how to explain the passage that the eunuch was reading?  In Acts 6, seven men were to be chosen for ministry and the men needed to posses certain qualifications for ministry.  The qualifications were the following:  “…men of good reputation, full of the Holy Spirit and wisdom,” to which Philip was chosen as one of the seven.  Philip had a good reputation among the Church.  He was also full of the Holy Spirit; he didn’t operate on his own but was rather guided and obedient to the Holy Spirit which was upon his life.  And finally Philip had wisdom, knowing the Word of God and the God of the Word!  It’s no wonder why he was able to explain the Word of God to this man.  Ray Comfort often says there are only two times to share the Gospel, “in season and out of season,” to which Philip exemplified this reality.

Preach Jesus.  Perhaps this sounds like a no brainer, but there is something that can easily be missed here.  Philip preached Jesus, because the man he spoke to was humble and therefore ready for the Gospel of Christ.  Although Philip finished with preaching Jesus, he did not start there.  He started with the prophets, specifically the book of Isaiah chapter 53.   Philip realized how to take this passage and point to the man to Christ with it.  Would you have been able to the same?  It is wise to be able to start with the Law and the Prophets but they both point to Christ and we should learn how to take people from there to Jesus as Philip did.  Some people are not ready to hear about Christ yet however, because they are not broken over their sin by the Law of God nor does the one you may be witnessing to see by the Old Testament prophets that the prophets all pointed to Christ and the coming of the Messiah.  In this Isaiah passage it reads, ﻿﻿“He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; And as a lamb before its shearer is silent, ﻿﻿So He opened not His mouth.33In His humiliation His ﻿﻿justice was taken away, And who will declare His generation? For His life is ﻿﻿taken from the earth.”

Isaiah 53:7 points us to Jesus who was the sheep lead to the slaughter during His crucifixion (John 10).  Following this the prophet wrote, “As a lamb before its shearers is silent” Recall when Jesus was being accused, and remember his response in Matthew 27 which reads, “﻿12﻿ And while He was being accused by the chief priests and elders, ﻿He answered nothing. ﻿13﻿ Then Pilate said to Him, ﻿﻿“Do You not hear how many things they testify against You?” ﻿14﻿ But Heanswered him not one word, so that the governor marveled greatly.  In his humility His justice was taken away.  Luke 23:1-25 records the fulfillment of this.  “And who will declare His generation? For His life is ﻿﻿taken from the earth,” Luke 23:33 – 46 displays the fulfillment of this aspect of the prophecy in the life of Christ.  Philip knew this and began to explain these things to the eunuch he share the Gospel with, because he knew the truth.  Once again, would you be able to explain such a thing?  Philip was not a pastor, but a deacon of the Church, yet he was equipped to stand for the Gospel and this crucial moment.  I encourage you to also get equipped to share the Gospel with the lost.  If you met a Jewish person this passage of Scripture is an excellent one to point out to them as it talks about Jesus Christ.  Furthermore, many Jewish people they also accept the Law of Moses.  Did you know that most of the witnessing done in the New Testament was when a follower of Christ shared the Gospel with a stranger as opposed to a follower of Christ only sharing their faith with someone they had a previous relationship with?  Please visit our website and click on the pie graph for an explanation of this, which can be found atwww.soulfishinministries.org.

Reaching people for Christ is the highest calling anyone can have, and if you are a Christian then He has commanded you to share your faith with lost sinners, so that they might come to know Him.  We are called to know God and to make Him known.  It is simply not enough to talk to God about the unsaved in prayer, but we must also talk to the unsaved about God.  Now go and be faithful.

Until the nets are filled…Phil Sessa, Evangelist – Soulfishing Ministries <><
