content.rendered:
Good morning,

Proverbs 22: 6 Train up a child in the way he should go, And when he is old he will not depart from it”

This is one of those scriptures that I struggled to understand having observed what happens in homes including ours. One thing that bothered me was seeing children from even Christian homes go a stray, walk away from God and go their way. They were raised going to church, in the word, parents prayed for them and this is what they turned out to become?

How is this verse then applicable when it suggests that if you train the child the way he should go, HE WILL NOT DEPART FROM THE TEACHING? Already it appears they are departing according to these statistics “88% of children raised in evangelical homes leave church at the age of 18 never to return.” That is an alarming rate. The Holy Spirit gave me an understanding on this scripture by viewing it this way, “train up a child in the way he should go, and when he is old, however hard he may try to run away from the teaching, it will always be present with him, he cannot depart from it”. Whatever he was taught or observed at home will not depart from him. That is why it’s important that children be invested in. As a parent, you don’t want to suffer the heartache of your children rebelling against their Christian upbringing. While only God can save us and keep us, there are biblical principles you can implement to help prevent your children from tragically falling away from the faith even in their later years in life.

I remember my dad setting the best example for his children and also was mom. I learn more by observing and many of his teachings in my life came from observing his Christian walk. My dad was (is) a prayer warrior, who conquered more devils in his family on his knees. To raise up a big family sometimes making tough decisions had to be done on his knees (praying). I listened to him many times praying for our future (my siblings and I); to be used of God one day, to have godly blessed relationships, to make intelligent decisions, to be successful etc. I learnt what it meant to be in a good respectable relationship by watching him treat his wife (my mom). What I’m I saying, even in my teenage life where the urge to rebel was beginning to creep in, their teachings, their life style could not depart from me. This is why it’s important that parents live an example of grace before their children through worship, reading of the word, praying, relating to each other (husband and wife), and how you train your children. It’s sad when spouses fight before their children, disrespecting each other before their kids. Do everything with dignity; you are setting an example to your children. At times it’s good to show tough love, it may not be popular at the time you are giving it but it will be appreciated later in life. Seeing dads become more responsible at home sets an example to the boys, its key, it’s vital. Who better teach them what it means to work hard, be responsible, have character and integrity than the parents.

I believe this could be a reason to have brought home the prodigal son in Luke 11, 17 “But when he came to himself, …! 18 I will arise and go to my father, and will say to him, “Father, I have sinned against heaven and before you, 19 and I am no longer worthy to be called your son. Make me like one of your hired servants”, I don’t think only the food and the good life at home would have driven him to go back, love, support, the teachings he had received would bring him back home. Yes he tried to run away from them all, but they would not. The earlier teachings brought him to himself to revisit how he was raised and how he turned everything into a mess. This brought about the heart of repentance and willing to go back home because regardless of where he had been, and who would not receive him, he knew he had a father who loved him and would be willing to receive him. How did he know, he had learnt it years back. It is a tough job but you and I have a responsibility to train and therefore it starts with us. We cannot teach what we don’t know and are not willing to live. Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning, 
Psalm 100:1-5, 1 Make a joyful shout to the LORD, all you lands!2Serve the LORD with gladness; Come before His presence with singing. 3Know that the LORD, He is God; It is He who has made us, and not we ourselves;[1] We are His people and the sheep of His pasture.4Enter into His gates with thanksgiving, And into His courts with praise. Be thankful to Him, and bless His name. 5For the LORD is good; His mercy is everlasting, …

It’s very important to start your day on a good note; it has a way of affecting your entire day. I tend to be very busy and tired many times but it matters a lot to me how I start my day.

We all have a way of affecting how we start the day, it’s a choice that we’ve got to make and declare otherwise we become victims of stress, frustrations and lack happiness trying to do what is right. The bible tells us that “the joy of the Lord is my strength”. If we take a close look at the word joy, it’s more than happiness for happiness tend to go with how you feel at a given time especially when everything is going the right way, joy comes when you know that regardless of what you have to deal with whether going forward or backward, you will make it, in other words rejoicing in the end result rather than the process. The joy of the Lord makes us comfortable in the situations that make other people uncomfortable.

Psalm 100 is a psalm of joy and singing, it starts with make a joyful shout to the Lord. I don’t have to shout joyfully to be heard by people, I can shout inside and when my inside is affected, my outside appearance will be the result of what is going on inside. Serving the Lord with gladness is awesome for I know that whenever I sit to work at my station, I’m working and serving the Lord. This is a blessed time where I come in the morning to work and say Lord, I thank you for another opportunity to serve in my department and serve others shinning for the Lord at my work place. You see His word says that whatsoever thy hand finds to do, do it with all of your might without murmuring or complaining and the Lord of reward shall reward you.

Come before His presence with singing. I believe that music is the greatest tool used to uplift hearts. There is nothing I know people respond to like music and that is why we can buy music over and over again; we can have hundreds of music collections. We can listen to music over and over again. The bible says that the Lord inhabits the praises of His people and we do a lot of praises through singing and listening to music. You got to give something to get something. A song with you will help you go through the day. When King Saul was being tormented by evil spirits, guess what he did, he had David playing music in his presence and the more he played, the quicker the evil spirit left. Replace your worries and anxieties with a song in your ear.

Enter into His gates with thanksgiving and into His courts with praise. I love this line for this reminds me to go beyond where I am. Entering into His gates and into His courts allows me to leave outside everything that will interfere with my praise while I’m serving Him everyday. There is power in thanksgiving and when I enter into His gates, I begin to see that He has done more than I need to thank Him for and not always concentrate on what I’ve got to gain from Him everyday.

This is a choice everyone has to make, yes we will have so much on our plates that we need to accomplish and yes we will be dealing with tough customers on the phone,  but we’ve been given the power to change the course of the day by allowing the joy of the Lord to be our strength. Keep a song with you, enter His gates and into His courts, refuse anything that will steal your praise, have a thankful heart and joy and be a beacon of light. I’ve made up my mind to start and finish the day well: I’ve said it, I mean it and I’m here to represent it, blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Chronicles 13:14, “The ARK of God remained with the family of Obed-Edom in his house three months. And the Lord blessed the house of Obed-Edom and all that he had”

David while he had a high position thought he could do things his way including handling the things of God. Our position should not dictate how we handle the things of God, our obedience through submission is what opens doors for His blessings. We can gain positions without letting positions steal the presence of God by starting in the Spirit and staying in the Spirit regardless of whether we have positions or not.Positions are temporal but God’s presence is eternal whether in our lives or not. This morning I will touch on the ARK looking at it from the blessings perspective.

It happened that as David and his men were bringing the ARK home, they did not follow the proper procedure of handling the ARK. The Levites were the priests chosen to carry the ARK and be worshippers but David decided to have the ARK on a new cart and drove it. One man by the name of Uzza was struck dead by God when he reached out to help the ARK that had stumbled. Because David did not follow the proper way of handling the ARK, one man died.  1Chronicles 13:12, “David was afraid of God that day, saying, “How can I bring the ARK of God to me?”. David recognized the mistake he had made for God wasn’t going to be treated casually and served anyway men wanted. God has His way of being served and in as much as we may try to do it our way, it will not work. It’s his way or no way, His will and not ours. They were excited from the beginning about bring home the presence of God, all of a sudden, the joy  turned into mourning. However, look further at what the Lord did. David decided to leave the ARK in Obed-Edom’s house who I believe was a Levite, meanwhile David went back home to get things ready and this time to bring home the ARK the right way.

1Chronicles 13:14, “The ARK of God remained with the family of Obed-Edom in his house three months. And the Lord blessed the house of Obed-Edom and all that he had”. What a blessing to know that when His presence is handled right, He opens the windows of heaven and pours us blessings that we will not even have enough room to contain them all.This was not an earned blessing, this was a bestowed blessing. A man opened his house for the presence of God to dwell in inform of the ARK of God, which opened ways for blessings. The Lord says, “Blessings, I will bless you” but we have to allow Him to come in and dwell with us for the blessings to flow. Obed-Edom might have not had a great position but the presence of the ARK sure made him be blessed. Proverbs 10:22, “The blessings of the Lord makes rich, and adds no sorrow with it”. This is more than the material richness, this goes for spiritual stuff, wisdom, understanding, discernment, character enlargement. The blessings of the Lord touches on every part of our lives.

Are you worried about position or His presence? Is the position more important to you than His presence? Do you want the blessings without the presence? As long as the ARK of God remained in Obed-Edom’s house, God blessed him and his home abundantly. I desire the ARK always in my life, which means desiring God’s presence everyday. The Israelites did not enquire of the Lord during the times of Saul; I have purposed to go back to inquiring of the Lord even more because I need more blessings. Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Matthew 9:37, “Then He said to His disciples, “The harvest truly is plentiful, but the laborers are few 38, “Therefore pray the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into His harvest.”

While Jesus was on the face of the earth, He was limited to time and space. Only one place at a time could He be in. He was stretched in the life span of three years of His ministry on earth and I would say He worked overtime. Matthew 8:20, “And Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head.” While the disciples slept, He labored at night in prayers and did ministry during day time. He did not have an organized structure, He wasn’t a pastor of an organized church meeting in a place but indeed He was a Shepherd. Being that He was limited to time and space, He did the much He could do and left the rest for the disciples and us who came along to continue with the great work.

Matthew 9:37, “Then He said to His disciples, “The harvest truly is plentiful, but the laborers are few“, Looking around, I am a witness of the harvest truly being plentiful. We can act like it’s not but the truth of the matter is, it is indeed. As the harvest is plentiful guess what?, the devil is working overtime when believers are seating on their pews singing “Amazing grace”. Wars have increased, kidnappings, rapes, murders, abortion, disobedience, hatred, rebellion, lawlessness, all these have increased because the devil is working overtime. Think about it, temptations are working overtime, fear is doing the same and the devil is putting off fires in believers who are careless to discern the time they are living in. Many are naming the name of Christ thinking they are safe but here is something to think about, “In our societies it’s alwaysINNOCENT till proven GUILTY, in Christ, GUILTY till proven INNOCENT. Can you see how the harvest is plenteous? Yes we have people who have never received Christ and they know it and then there are those who are deceiving themselves to thinking they have Him simply because they mention His name. If someone tells me that he/she is a believer, they are guilty before my eyes till they prove they are innocent through Repentance towards God and Faith in Christ. In other words hearing them say they have made peace WITH God. The harvest is plenteous and we as believers have to wake up from doing regular hours to doing overtime to win that which is lost, from guilt to innocence.

Vs 38, “Therefore pray the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into His harvest.” I used to think that by being called to be a prayer warrior, I was suppose to pray that God would raise up other people to do the work only to discover that the more I prayed to God to raise up laborers, the more I realized that I was the answered prayer. You pray for laborers and you find you are the laborer you’ve been praying for. Imagine a blind man walking towards the cliff, and you know for sure that he is going to die when he falls over, but you stand there and pray that God will bring someone else other than you to run and tell him to turn around. You and I have a moral obligation to tell the blind man walking towards the cliff to turn around. Check this, James 5:19, “Brethren, if anyone among you wanders from the truth, and someone turns him back, 20, let him know that he who turns a sinner from the error of his way will save a soul from death and cover a multitude of sins“. It’s a blessing to know that God could use you to save a soul. There is so much to be done and very few people to do it. The ones who could step out and do the work have been consumed by structures, programs and traditions. Nothing wrong with them but at the expense of the lost? If we continue to sit and do nothing, the enemy will continue to work overtime. We better rise up and begin to work overtime ourselves. We might not see the payoff immediately but the One who holds the universe has your records of faithfulness in the back of His mind. God help me to be faithful in harvesting, help me work overtime, go out of my way. Correct me if I am wrong, overtime is time and a half and sometimes double time right? could God reward overtime? Why not, can’t wait for my pay. If the devil is working overtime, why can’t we? . Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

James 5:16, “…The effective, fervent prayer of a righteous man avails much

Hannah in our text this morning had a loving and caring husband. She was married to Elkanah who also had another wife called Peninnah. We are not told who was the first wife of the two, we are told Elkanah loved Hannah more than Peninnah for we see how they get treated when it came to getting gifts Vs 4&5, “And whenever the time came for Elkanah to make an offering, he would give portions to Peninnah his wife… vs. 4 But to Hannah he would give a double portion, for he loved Hannah”.  God had blessed Peninnah with the fruit of the womb, she had children while Hannah was barren for the Lord had [closed her womb. You would think her  joy would come from all these.  In life we always assume that people who have riches are happy because they can afford to have anything they want but most of the time they are the most miserable people.

Hannah may have been ok with her situation until her rival Peninnah began to provoke her severely to make her miserable according to1Samuel 1:6 and I am not surprised for I saw this between Leah and Rachel, Jacob’s wives who had the same rival. Leah had children, Rachel did not, Jacob loved Rachel more than Leah and therefore Leah provoked her daily and that made Rachel desire a child. Hannah was provoked so much that she desired a child of her own too. We too can be provoked by people around us to desire bigger cars, bigger houses, bigger promotions, bigger ministries or anything you could be provoked to want but the question is, what is the motive that drives you to pray. Yes they are good things that one can desire to have but the motive for desiring them can be wrong. “I want to be big that I may fit in, or feel better than someone else, or not feel rejected, or that my pride may get the best of me” remember James 4:3, “Ye ask and receive not, because you ask a miss, that you may consume it upon your lusts”. In other words at times when we ask, it’s for the wrong reasons, even something good. Hannah desired a child, question is, what was her motive? Did she want a child to get back at her rival, or did she want a child so that she could  feel blessed too,  or that she would not be attacked any more? Any of the above could have been her motive and therefore, year in year out she prayed but God would not answer her prayers. Don’t blame God for not answering your prayers when you know for sure that if He answered them, you will not go to church anymore, you will not give Him glory, you will be prideful. God will not give you something He knows will destroy you until you begin to get your act together. Some people desire to be in a relationship, married, used of God, etc, the question is what is your motive?

Hannah may have revisited her year in year out prayers and saw how selfish her prayers was and how God would not respond to such a prayer because we see her pray in 1Samuel 1:11, “Then She made avow and said, “O Lord of hosts, if You will indeed look on the affliction of Your maidservant and remember me, and not forget Your maid servant, but will give Your maidservant a male child, then I will give him to the Lord all the days of his life, no razor shall come upon his head”. This is effective praying, this is the type of prayer that supersedes  our selfish desires and ambitions for we begin to see that anything God is going to bring our way is not for us but for many. He may entrust it in our custody but it’s not for us. Her vow was to allow her son to be God’s servant all the days of his life, I could imagine God saying “I’ve waited  for you to pray like this for I now know for sure that honor and glory will come back to me”. After she prayed this prayer, her desire was granted but more than she had asked for. She asked for a male child, God gave her a prophet Ephesians 3:20, “Now to Him who is able to do exceedingly abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that works in us,?

Now I understand why many people cannot be used of God, they will love the praises of men and God will not get any of it. 2Cor 4:7, “But we have this treasure in the earthen vessels that the excellence of the power maybe of God and not of us“. The bible says that our God is a jealous God and He will not share His glory with no one else. About 12 years ago God could not use me fully for every time He did something through me, I took the credit in the sense that when people thanked me, I responded “you are welcome” instead of saying give God all the glory. He began to work in me and then trusted me with the work again and the more I gave Him the glory, the more He used me; the more I decreased, the more he increased because my motives were now right. When I pray now for a promotion, a better place to live, and to be used more is because I want to glorify Him in all things and many may be blessed through the elevation for it’s all about Him. My motive is to build a testimony that many may know that God is able. John the Baptist was told that Jesus was doing the work that John should have been doing, his response, John 3:30, “He must increase, that I may decrease”.Because of Hannah’s change of prayer attitude, Samuel is born to become of the greatest prophets for he served many. Yes the mother rejoiced to have received a male child (prophet), God used His gift to the woman to reach many, God also blessed her some more 1 Samuel 2:21, “And the LORD visited Hannah, so that she conceived and bore three sons and two daughters. Meanwhile the child Samuel grew before the LORD. Rachel bore Joseph who became  the No. 2 man in Egypt. What is that thing you have desire and prayed about? what was your motive? The effective, fervent prayer of a righteous man avails much”. This concludes the series. Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

James 5:16, “…The effective, fervent prayer of a righteous man avails much”

I believe that some people God has honored the most are the people who did not waste their trying times. Instead of blaming God or asking themselves and the Lord why they were in such situations, they began to praise and thank God for counting them worthy to go through it. Their prayers in situations like that changed as they saw an opportunity to pray to God to do something greater for Himself while they were in the situation. This is why I say, “don’t waste your trying moments”.

There has been great persecution of believers in some parts of India. While we would want to pray for persecution to stop, you know what most of them are praying? That they will be bold to stand firm in their walk and in their preaching. What an effective prayer and why pray in this manner? they understand that through adversities, the gospel spreads like wild fire. The more the Egyptians oppressed the Israelites and even killed them, the more they multiplied and grew Exodus 1:12 and so is India and many other countries where there is great persecution yet it’s not silencing the gospel.

Acts 4, Peter and John are arrested for preaching Christ; they had just performed a miracle that started the trouble. They were then brought before the high priest and their family members and with boldness, Peter preached Christ. Even with that they threatened them the most not to preach Jesus, Acts 4:17-21. How would you have prayed in this situation? probably for the persecution to stop, but they prayed in this way vs. 29, “Now, Lord, look on their threats, and grant to Your servants that with all boldness they may speak Your word”, they were not going to let adversities dictate what they could do, they saw it as an opportunity to preach the word and their cry to God was for boldness. They refused to waste their trying period.

Then we see Paul and Silas in Acts 16 perform a miracle by casting out demonic forces out of a girl who brought her masters much profit by fortune-telling Acts 16:16. The girl’s masters seeing their lost means of income, dragged Paul and Silas before the magistrate, falsely accusing them of many things. They were beaten severely, thrown in prison, their feet locked, and even having guards to securely watch them. In that situation, the bible says, vs. 25. At midnight Paul and Silas werepraying and singing hymns to God, and the prisoners were listening to them”, what did they pray for, to get out? I doubt it. I believe they preached Christ and then prayed for the prisoners’ hearts to be softened to receive the gospel. Then Acts 16:26, “Suddenly there was a great earthquake, so that the foundations of the prison were shaken; and immediately all the doors were opened and everyone’s chains were loosed.”, it appears their work there was almost done until the prison keeper awoke from his sleep, almost killed himself because he thought all the prisoners had escaped but Paul assured him they were all present. Vs 30, “And he brought them out and said, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?” 31 So they said, “Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and you will be saved, you and your household.” Imagine if they just sat there nursing their pain and complaining to God, they would have wasted their trial moments instead they maximized the opportunity to preach, pray, give praise to God through singing and led the prison keeper and his family to the Lord. They too refused to waste their trying moments. After it was said and done, I could see them saying, “it was worth the experience”.

You could be sick and may end up in hospital, or are facing the worst trying time and feel like asking God the “Why” question, or feeling persecuted at work to name a few. What is your prayer when you feel like you are between a rock and a hard place? Are you going to waste your trying moments by complaining or pray to God to show you how to maximize every opportunity in that trying moment?. James 5:16, “…The effective, fervent prayer of a righteous man avails much” , your effective prayer will avail much.

 

Read this testimony about the lady we were praying for last week concerning her trying moment and how she maximized.

Dear Bro Olang in Christ,

All Glory and Honour to our Mighty God.

Sister Rani is getting discharged from the hospital today. The doctors are surprised and say that she is lucky that her system is responding to the treatment as this is a unique case. Sister rani told them “My God is a Mighty God and with Him all things are possible”. They know it is the Lord who is treating her and guiding them and His hands are upon her. Our Lord is continuously speaking to her through the Doctors (One surgeon told her to keep on claiming the Word. The moment he told her this, she felt ..an electric current passing through her body right from her head, through her spine and till her toes), the staff and people who meet her. Even on the bed she keeps serving the Lord. She takes requests from people who serve her and keeps praying for them. I give her few requests everyday in the evening and she prays happily. I really admire her faith and that faith is making me stronger day by day. When they poked her for blood, injections she would screem but say “Lord I know are with me” and at once they would get her vein”. My heart ached when she scremed but when I heard her calling unto the Lord I could’nt stop crying.

Thank you and the team for the prayers.

God Bless
Mary

Thanks 
Ev

content.rendered:
James 5:16, “…The effective, fervent prayer of a righteous man avails much“

What comes out of our mouths in prayer reveals what’s in our mind and heart when we pray. Have you ever asked yourself while praying, how would Jesus pray in and for a situation like the one you are praying for? Philippians 2:5, “Let this mind be in you which was also in Christ Jesus,” to have the mind of Christ will drive away any of our selfish desires and we pray the heart of God in a situation rather than our own.

John 11 is the story of Jesus raising Lazarus from the dead. John tells us of Jesus relationship to Lazarus, Mary and Martha (sisters and brother).  John says, Mary is the one who anointed the Lord with fragrant oil. When Lazarus was sick, vs. 3. “…the sisters sent to Him, saying, “Lord, behold, he whom You love is sick.” Vs 5. “Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus“. John stresses the word love for a reason. There was such a bond, such connection. Anything they may have needed the One who loved them would provide if they asked. Lazarus is sick, they ask (pray) the Lord to come and heal. We would expect Jesus to rise up and rush to the aid of His friends He loved. Well, we are told He stayed where He was for two more days. I believe Jesus knew Lazarus would die and He let him die, He did not even make it to the burial. What was the mind of Christ in this situation and how would have others processed His mind?

Let’s find out why He did not respond to their prayer when they needed Him the most. He had a bigger picture in mind than what Lazarus’ sisters and others would have thought. For them a brother alive and well was good enough, while Jesus had a different way of looking at it, 1. This was a situation that would allow God the Father to be glorified in it and so was His Son glorified through it, vs. 4. “When Jesus heard that, He said, “This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God may be glorified through it. 2. He wanted the situation to build the disciples faith far beyond healing vs. 15, “And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, that you may believe”, 3. He wanted to show those who were present that He was sent of God and had the power to resurrect the ones He loves (salvation) vs. 41, “Jesus lifted up His eyes and said, “Father, I thank You that You have heard Me. 42 And I know that You always hear Me, but because of the people who are standing by I said this, that they may believe that You sent Me.” The sisters and the people who came to mourn did not have the mind of Christ otherwise they would have seen the bigger picture. Mary and Martha both said “Lord, if You had been here, my brother would not have died” at different times, vs. 36, “Then the Jews said, “See how He loved him!” 37 And some of them said, “Could not this Man, who opened the eyes of the blind, also have kept this man from dying?” minds limited to the natural human thinking.

Jesus on the other hand wanted to pray the heart of the Father in the situation. How about when the devil desired to sift Simon Peter, the Lord did not rebuke the devil, what did He tell Peter, Luke 22:31, And the Lord said, “Simon, Simon! Indeed, Satan has asked for you, that he may sift you as wheat. 32 But I have prayed for you, that your faith should not fail; and when you have returned to Me, strengthen your brethren.”, Again we see the Lord addressing a bigger picture. The bigger picture show that it's way bigger than us and our needs. When we have the mind of Christ, our approach to effective praying would be through His eyes and not ours. Making prayers that are Christ centered and for it to be Christ centered, it has to begin with the mind of Christ.

content.rendered:
Good morning,

James 5:16, “…The effective, fervent prayer of a righteous man avails much”

Many times I’m asked to keep someone in prayers for financial breakthrough, healing, salvation, protection among others. And what a blessing to bring needs before the Lord and I always do. Not too long ago the Lord began to deal with me about praying for needs, something bigger than what I am used to praying. Hope I can lay some groundwork first and then give examples from the bible about effective prayers that avails much.

I am constantly reminded that prayer is not so much about what I get but how I am changed by it and in it. And because prayer changes me, it changes how I approach God too for my needs and needs of others. For example, if you were to pray for someone’s salvation, how would you pray? You may pray something like this, “Lord save my loved one, so that he can know you and go to heaven when he dies”Nothing wrong with that, what I will call an effective prayer for a lost one would be something like this, “Lord awaken my loved one lost in sin, rebelling against you, Lord help them see their deep sin and wound their pride and ego, take away anything that cloud their minds and blocks their eyes even if it’s a good thing, that they may surrender to you in repentance and faith. Lord I’m not praying that you save my loved one so that he can go to heaven, I’m praying that you save my loved one for your glory, so that He can serve you, live for you, walk with you, and one day be with you in heaven”, it’s easy to pray for salvation when you see how it will benefit you, “if my loved ones are saved, I will see them in heaven; oh and the fights at home will stop; at least we can raise our children in the things of God as we would be in agreement, he can be better husband, treating me right etc”, all these are ok prayers, but not effective to avail much, why? James 4:3, “You ask and do not receive, because you ask amiss, that you may spend it on your pleasures”, either we do not ask for the right ends or not in a right manner, not in faith or fervency. There is amiss in those prayers that takes God off the focus and places the focus on the person you are interceding for. Where there is amiss, there is a drift.

How about praying for someone else who has a need, instead of first praying that God provide the need, how about you pray that God will establish their faith. If you are praying for them and they are doubting, how will that be effective? Jesus performed miracles based on the individual’s faith, Matthew 9:22, “But Jesus turned around, and when He saw her He said, “Be of good cheer, daughter; your faith has made you well.” And the woman was made well from that hour. Matthew 9:29, “Then He touched their eyes, saying, “According to your faith let it be to you.”  Their faith gave God the glory. In praying also, why not sometimes pray that in that situation God would grow them more in holiness, patience, establish their character, integrity, that the blessing may be more to His glory than for what it means to them and to you. Praying His will may to prevail.

In our own needs we could be praying “God get me out of this” or pray effectively, “Lord teach me to endure, teach me self denial, help me learn all that I need to learn in my situation. Help me see the bigger picture than what I desire for you to do in my life”. We often hear declarations in prayers “claim it and receive it”, that can be dangerous and this is why, you may not have the character and integrity to maintain the blessing, so what was supposed to be a blessing turns into a curse, how about we pray, “Lord prepare me, show me my pride, my stinginess, build a strong foundation in me, help me grow in the fruit of the spirit, perform what is best to your glory”. How you pray will reveal more of your motives, many times our motives are for selfish reasons the reason we need to learn to pray effectively for ourselves and those we pray for. I will share on examples in the bible of effective prayers. Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Matthew 21:9, “Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”

Blessings, blessings, blessings, who does not need blessings? How would we define blessings and how does it apply to our lives? Blessed is to INVOKE A DEVINE FAVOR UPON. Blessed it is to confer wellbeing or prosperity on. Blessing is a divine favor from above, it comes down from a blessed Father extending His blessings to a people who do not deserve it and never will. The difference between blessed and blessings is that blessed is already favored and blessings is bestowed.

Throughout the bible, you will come across the word blessed and blessings; it’s a reminder to us that the same Father of blessings is still favoring His people even today. We have to be in a rightful position to receive it and more important be called blessed. Mark the way I put it, not having everything in place but being in the right place doing the right things and awaiting Our Heavenly Father to rain blessings on us. There are people who forfeit the blessing because they want to be blessed but are not willing to do what it takes to be blessed.

Psalm 1:1 starts in a very interesting way, “Blessed is the man who walks not in the counsel of the ungodly, Nor stands in the path of sinners, Nor sits in the seat of the scornful”. One is blessed when he or she is not in the counsel of the ungodly, this kind of sounds confusing but I would like us to know that we as believers can and need to mix with unbelievers with a desire to win them to Christ, but we can not go by their wisdom and standards on how to live, move and the like. Believers should set up a standard for the unbelievers not the other way round. Blessed are we when we set up standards not according to the ways of man, but according to the ways of God.

Psalm 32:1, “Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered”. I had not know sin but by the law and when the law revealed to me that I had failed, when I confessed my sins, He blessed me by forgiving and covering my sin that as far as the east is from the west, so has He forgiven my sins and placed them in the sea of forgetfulness. I am blessed because He took away my sins. Are you blessed in this area of forgiveness? Psalm 41:1, “Blessed is he that considers the poor: the Lord will deliver him in time of trouble“, Giving to the poor may not necessarily mean giving material things; it could mean giving our spiritual wealth. People can be poor spiritually and with one depositing encouragement, joy, and smile to their account, they will be gaining back what they lacked and what a blessing to be in a position to bless someone else. Giving is like planting a seed, one plants, another waters and God gives the increase. Prov 18:22, “The blessings of the Lord makes rich, and adds no sorrows with it”, We give not because we want to gain back though we know we will, but we give because we have been blessed. Daniel 12:12, “Blessed is he that waits”, we get blessed as we patiently serve the Lord and serve others. Math 11:16, “And blessed is he, whosever is not offended by me“, offenses, unforgiveness and resentments have been used of the enemy to rob people of blessings and the reason being that it disconnects you from the One who offers blessings and so you miss what you should have. Offences assassinate every blessing bestowed upon you and so instead of you walking in victories, you become a victim of circumstance. Rev 1:3, “Blessed is he that reads, and hear the word of the prophesy, and keep those things which are written thereon: for the time is at hand”. Ever thought whether hearing and keeping the words of the Lord was a blessing? when we are not reading and keeping His word, we are missing the blessing of being nourished and refreshed through His word that is life to us. I think that this is one of the biggest blessings one could receive for it sets us to a place where we can know the author of blessings (favor). Rev 16:15, “Behold, I come as a thief. Blessed is he that watches, and keeps his garment, lest he walked naked, and they see his shame”. Glory to God for He is coming back soon, sooner than we expected and blessed are those who are ready, watching for His coming and are not getting weary and tired of waiting. Blessed is he that has his garments ready, he is dressed for the coming of Christ, he is ready to leave at any given time.

With all the scriptures I have touched on, you can see that someone will be called blessed because they are doing the right things. In as much as we receive blessings from above, the right things we do like reaching out to our neighbors, helping customers, helping our colleagues make it through the day, going out of our way, reading his word, praying, waiting for Him, witnessing, striving to be holy, all these makes one blessed. I don’t know about you but I am blessed in the field, everything I touch God blesses it, my family is blessed, my work is blessed, my ministry is blessed, my going out and my coming in are blessed, I’m blessed as I drive, I’m not blessed when I have received it, I’m blessed even as I am awaiting, I am blessed as I encourage and uplift others. I am blessed as I do devotions, what comes out of my mouth is blessed for it is good and you know why I am blessed? because I am connected to a blessed Father. When you are asking to be blessed or asking others to pray for you to be blessed, do you have what it takes? Are you in a rightful position? No amount of prayer for you to be blessed will do you any good if you are outside His will that is Blessed is He that comes in the name of the Lord. Blessings Ev.

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Kings 5:1-14, “And Elisha sent a messenger to him, saying, “Go and wash in the Jordan seven times, and your flesh shall be restored to you, and you shall be clean.”

I believe in God’s healing power. I know of divine (miracle) healing or using doctors to bring to treat but He gets the glory. There are some religions that rule out God’s ability to bring healing by medicine, that’s a lie to be rejected. We cannot limit God to what He can and cannot use. He has a lot of ways and means to heal. You could be needing healing this morning but right in the back of your mind, you are condemning yourself thinking that the reason why you are sick is because of a sin in your life. Let me tell you, God is not the author of sickness; He is the author of healing. Sickness gives Him an opportunity to demonstrate His power. Satan is the author of all kinds of problems including sickness, “John 10:10, “The thief (Satan, devil) does not come except to steal, and to kill, and to destroy. Jesus says, “I have come that they may have life, and that they may have it more abundantly“. This is not just for spiritual life but also physical. God desires that we maybe healed for His glory. He is sovereign over all.

In my text, Naaman comes to Elisha sick with leprosy. A slave girl mentioned there was a prophet who could heal him yet Naaman does so many wrong things before his actual healing takes place simply because he was proud and arrogant. When he comes to Elisha, he has his own idea of how he should be healed. Elisha is about to teach him that healing is far beyond praying for someone and they get healed. He sends his messenger to tell Naaman to go and wash seven times in the river Jordan. Does Elisha know that Naaman is a captain? deals with Kings? has servants beneath him? instead of him even coming to meet him, he sends a messenger (servant) to tell him to go and wash in a dirty river. What a nerve!!!!. That is what is wrong with many who come to Christ today, they want to come and serve Christ in their terms! they exercise that mentality in everything in their lives including healing. Here is the thing, God’s way or no way, you are the one in need of a touch not God. You have to humble yourself, have faith in God to do whatever He says. Naaman is very upset and ready to go back home because he feels Elisha has insulted him. Finally his servants convinces him to do it cause had Elisha asked him for something big and greater, he would have done it. Out of what Naaman was suppose to do, Elisha had no gain in it, it was all to Naaman’s benefit.

Finally he goes and deeps himself in the river 7 times, gets healed and has a better skin compared to how his skin was before he had leprosy. You might say, the healing was waiting for him at the river, NO, the healing took place the moment he humbled himself, had faith and moved. Mark 16:17, “And these signs will follow those who believe..“ miracles are the aftermath of having faith that it can be done. Naaman’s victory was not in the miracle. It’s like God depositing healing in your bank account. The moment you believed that He could deposit it that was your victory there, the miracle becomes a confirmation. Signs and wonders only follow those who have believed. Have faith, that is where your healing lies. Laying hands on you and praying over you are the after math. Remember victory is not in the miracle, victory is in the faith you have in God. Be blessed Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 30:5, “… Weeping may endure for a night, But joy comes in the morning”

I’ve been to a few graduations of course including mine. Graduations tend to be one of those happy times seeing someone graduating. Surrounded by family and friends. Because it’s a joyous day, you will not find anyone in such occasions sad. But go back to what led to this occasion and find a lot of hard work, sleepless nights working on unending projects, writing reports, researching, studying etc, There were times of feeling like giving up but still endured to make it till the end. A goal was set and had to be worked towards. One thing that strikes me out of all these, the plan did not change for things to take place; one had to gain strength and confidence to work out the plan already executed.

How often do we hope that things will change when they get hard and complicated. We even pray for the Lord to move and change them. He has set the plan that you can see at the end of the tunnel but you hope that the burden will get easier for you to make it through. I am here to let you know that the Lord will not rearrange the process because it’s the process He is using to put you together. The process is the recipe to produce an end result. The Psalm I gave above says, “weeping may endure for a night“, hardship at times calls for weeping and its okay to weep but it’s not okay to allow the weeping to terminate the process that will lead you to your destination. It’s required to endure meaning to carry you through to continue in existence. So don’t pray for the rearrangement of the process, pray for the strength to endure the process. Night can be associated with loneliness, darkness not seeing what lies a head and believe me, it can be long. At times when it’s getting to dawn, it becomes even darker, that reminds us of the students when they are about to graduate, more endurance to study for the finals and it becomes hectic and hard but the student just can’t give up at dawn, their joy in the morning is just around the corner when they finish the finals and pass. They may endure alone in the night, but thank God it’s not forever.

The bible says in Psalm 126:5, “Those who sow in tears shall reap in joy”, how that is so true and that is why we need God everyday to give us strength to go on. It is hard and we all know for sure, we need a bigger hand not to change what we are facing but give us the strength and grace to endure through the night. The endurance has a lot of lessons you cannot learn in a classroom. Martha Stewart learnt a lot in prison while she endured her night. She confessed that there are things she would have never learnt in any other way had she not gone through what she went through. You have a greater testimony when you endure so whatever you are going through today, don’t ask God to change it, ask Him for strength to go on, your joy is about to come and you are about to reap too. Blessings Ev evipooh@gmail.com

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2 Corinthians 4:7, “But we have this treasure in earthen vessels,….”

In life, search for meaning is very vital, people tend to ask themselves, why am I here on earth? What is my purpose? Is my presence in this earth even significant? How do I play part in history. Discovering who you are and your purpose builds hope to know that you are not here in vain. Those who have terminated their lives often tend to have lost hope and purpose in life. There is nothing else to live for so why live.

It’s hard for many of my friends to believe I grew up a very shy boy, I never felt that there was more I could do in life. I felt who I was, was all I could be. My brothers and sister could do different things, myself, I did not feel able or capable of doing anything, especially standing before a congregation to speak. I was so shy that I told everyone that the day they would put me before a congregation, someone needed to make sure there was an ambulance outside waiting to drive me to the emergency room. It’s always easy to think that what you have now is all you got, What I came to realize as time went by in my walk and growth in the Lord was that all the treasures I needed to give me a purpose and worth in this life was not from WITHOUT but from WITHIN. It was always there waiting to be discovered. The ability to teach, preach, encourage, witness etc was always there. I often thought that God had to bring something new, no; it was always present within me. It’s about knowing where it should be and searching far and wide. Looking for it in the wrong places will not make you find it however diligent you may try. Matthew 6:21, “For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also“. Why do people look so hard?, because they think their treasure is out there, their hearts wander but the good news is, the treasure has always been within therefore the heart needs to be directed to the right place where the treasure is. It’s not your boyfriend or girl friend that gives you meaning in life, it’s God who does. It’s not even your wife or husband or your boss but God. In other words, you have to look down deep within yourself and see what God deposited in you to discover. What tanks within you are still left unopened?

2 Corinthians 4:7, “But we have this treasure in earthen vessels“, whenever we talk about treasures, we are not talking about cheap, broken, useless things, we are talking about valuable and precious possessions. These are things that ought to be guarded by all means, things that you don’t just let anyone on. God has placed such great treasures in each of us, the earthen vessels. I want you to see something out of this, first, you are a vessel, a container, a jar. No one makes a vessel if he has nothing to put in it, God made you a vessel because He had a treasure in mind to put in you, so you have a purpose and meaning in this life. Second, the vessel becomes meaningful when someone looks at the what is placed in it, this is what gives the vessel value. God has placed His Son Jesus Christ in your heart, the greatest treasure of them all. Luke 6:45, “A good man out of the good treasure of his heart bringeth forth that which is good“. You bring out the good because Christ in you is the treasure, the greatest possession you have. As we know we don’t bring out good because we are good, we bring out good because He is good. Isaiah 33:6…the fear of the LORD is his treasure”. Christ in you is enough to help you open the vessels with the talents, gifting and abilities you never knew you had. I took time to discover my treasures by trying them out with the help of God, the more I did, the more I saw life differently and the more I became fulfilled in Him. You might have not known you could sing, teach, encourage, build etc, you may have thought all you have now is all you are. You may have even tried finding it out there. You can discover your God hidden treasures by not looking from without but looking from within. What is it that God deposited in you and you never took time to find out because you were busy trying to find it somewhere else? It’s hidden to be discovered. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Salvation Is Free, Growth Is Hard Work

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Luke 1:39-45, Vs. 42, “…Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb!”

If any man be in Christ, he is a new creation, old things have passed a way, behold everything has become new, 2Cor 5:17. Salvation is the beginning of ones new life in Christ and not the end. We are sealed at the salvation stage and then the growth begins. Salvation is free, the growth and the anointing will cost you.

Mary visited Elizabeth when they were both pregnant. Both women were carrying seeds they never worked for and did not contribute to their existence in their wombs. The reason they carried the seeds was because they were CHOSEN. We too have been chosen by God to carry seeds as He is in need of us to accomplish certain things in this life for His kingdom. Every one has something that they can do for the Kingdom of God. Mary was pregnant with the Messiah, the Savior of the world and Elizabeth was pregnant with the preparer of the way. Both have different gifts but significant. Whichever good seed you are carrying it’s significant whether it be small or big. We are all called to be followers but not everyone is led to be a preacher, pastor, worship leader, manager or the like. You may have been led to be an encourager, singer, or prayer warrior. Some have been led to reach out to certain people no one can reach but them. Being faithful in carrying that seed will cause you to be fulfilled and that requires hard work.

When these two women met and greeted each other, the baby in Elizabeth leaped for joy and Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit. There is something about getting yourself close to those of the same spirit, same faith, growing in the Lord. Part of my growth has been contributed by others. Their life style and ministry provoked me to desire more of the Lord and talking to them, I always find that it cost them dearly to be where they are with the Lord. In every area be it in prayer, reading the word, doing memory verses, preaching, I had someone somewhere provoking me to get to where I needed to be. They were like God sent messengers to stir up something in me what He wanted to do in my life and the awakening is what I needed. This pushed me to adjust my life style, cut down things that hindered and slowed me down. I had to learn to deny myself things that brought about temporary pleasure and pursue Godly things. “Wherefore, my beloved, as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling, Phil 2:12.”, there are no shortcuts to growth. I haven’t reached where I believe I need to be but I’m working on it

Mary and Elizabeth were pregnant and would soon give birth. They had work to do, nature the babies when they were born until they were of age to fulfill the call of God in their lives. It was hard work to raise these babies. We are not led to be cheerleaders in the kingdom, we are players in a team who need to be in uniform then find our position in the field and be the player God wants us to be. Not every one can play defense, some play offense. Find your place in the kingdom and be active in it. Carry the seed, carry the fruits and change your entire surrounding because you are chosen. Surround yourself with those who challenge your walk. Be pregnant with destiny that heights, depths, principalities, rulers of darkness, spiritual wickedness, things present not even the things to come will abort the seed inside of you. Use your talents God has given you because God has chosen you for a time like this and “Blessed are you among women (men), and blessed is the fruit of your womb!”. Blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Philippians 4:6, “Be anxious for nothing, but in everything by prayer and supplication, 7and the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus”

I am very down to earth, very regular person and not super spiritual as some may think. I discipline myself through my struggles to read my bible and pray. It’s easy to do these things when you feel like it yet there is more to it than feelings, it’s all about discipline. As already said, getting into the presence of God and praying is hard but there is such a great joy when you do it. How often do we first try to do something, when it does not work out that is when we remember prayer?, I do. I think it’s a guy thing. Women are quick to ask for direction when they get lost, men try hard to find their way and sometimes get frustrated when encouraged to ask for directions.

In Luke 8:24, Jesus tells his disciples, “Let us cross over to the other side of the lake” and they launched out. It was Jesus idea to cross over with them. Being told to come from the familiar to the unfamiliar; from what they knew to what they did not know. There are people who get sea sick and there are people who are afraid of heights. No one is afraid of the ground because the ground is solid and you trust that it’s going to hold you up.. You do not need help with what you know, it’s what you don’t know. You may try get to help after failing to do it yourself. In this case, everything seams to be going well while Jesus is in the hindermost parts of the ship sleeping. The disciples seem to have everything under control, when all of a sudden there comes a storm. In the midst of the storm, they try to do everything to steady the ship and when all fails they remember that Jesus was on board … vs. 24, And they came to Him and awoke Him, saying, “Master, Master, we are perishing!” Philippians 4:6, “Be anxious for nothing” these men were anxious (very worried); they did not even stop to calm themselves down. All that consumed their mind was drowning. They had faith in Jesus but that faith seams to have leaped in the storm. Our faith should not disappear while in the storm, if anything, that is the time we need it the most. Had they meditated on the fact that Jesus was on board, they would have not worried, in fact it should have increased their faith. Think of it this way, if the storm came so strong, do you think Jesus would have drowned? Can God drown? That was enough to build their faith. “but in everything by prayer and supplication, with thanksgiving, let your requests be made known to God, Instead of freaking out and trying to do it themselves they could have called on Jesus on board. See, it says “in everything”, not some things. At times we feel like He is far away when we are in a storm when in the actual sense, He is with us and in us, on board. These men had an urgent need; their cry to Jesus was earnest and fervent. They called on Him, what took them so long to do it? Simple, they tried doing it themselves. The bible says Romans 10:13, “For “whoever calls on the name of the LORD shall be saved.” Easy to thank God when it’s done but here we are being reminded to thank God after making our petition in a situation.

vs. 7 and the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus”. Jesus wakes up and first deals with the situation, He says to the wind Mark 4:39, “…Peace, be still”, I see this as not just speaking peace to the wind but also speaking peace to the disciples. This is the peace that originates from God, it’s the peace that does not make sense cause they came back to speak to themselves saying, “What manner of man is this that even the winds obey His voice”, (paraphrased). Why peace and not deliverance? Peace can make you comfortable in a storm. Jesus was comfortable, sleeping peacefully in the ship knowing that He could never drown. When He woke up, He didn’t even make the ship move faster to the land. He wasn’t going to be subject to the situation, the situation was going to be subject to Him. Showing the wind who is boss. Jesus presence was peace alone and they could not be afraid anymore even if there came another storm. They did not even tell Jesus that they should to go back to the land. They had a journey started and yet to be finished so they needed to ride through by faith in Him who was on board. Take Philippians 4:6&7 as your sea sick medication and you will not get sea sick. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Here am I Send me, Part 3

content.rendered:
Good morning,
Isaiah 6:, vs. 8 Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying: “Whom shall I send, And who will go for Us?” Then I said, “Here am I! Send me.”

Who is the man of unclean lips, it’s one who has given the Lord the lip service but the heart was far away. Sang songs with our lips but did not honor the Lord with our actions making our lips unworthy. If the angels who I would consider more holy than man could gaze upon the Lord and cover their faces because of His holiness, how much more should we fear God and reverence in his presence? None of us comes even close. At least those who are saved are better off yet we still fall short of God’s glory. What about the lost souls? To quote Matthew Henry” Those who are to teach others the knowledge of God ought to be well acquainted with Him themselves”

I am a sinner; particularly, I have offended in word; and who is there that has not?. We are unworthy and unfit to take God’s name into our lips. With what a pure lip did the angels praise God! “But,” says the prophet, “I cannot praise him so, for I am a man of unclean lips.’ The impurity of our lips ought to be the grief of our souls, for by our words we shall be justified or condemned. It’s by the lips man curses God, uses His name as a curse word. Here is a man slain by the holiness of God, to have this experience, his thought could have been, “why didn’t the holiness of God slay me when He saw the sin in my life”. I ask myself this question many times.

Holiness is not what God does but who He is. God’s holiness is not tainted or corrupted. His character will not let Him turn blind eye to sin and let people go free. Because of his goodness, He will serve justice. He has done everything to rescue man from His wrath and by repentance towards Himself and faith in His Son, He will save. “God’s holiness demands that all sin be punished, but God’s love provides the plan and way of redemption for sinful man” Billy Graham.

Vs ﻿6﻿ Then one of the seraphim flew to me, having in his hand a live coal which he had taken with the tongs from ﻿the altar. ﻿7﻿ And he ﻿touched my mouth with it, and said: “Behold, this has touched your lips; Your iniquity is taken away, And your sin ﻿purged.”, the live coal directly to Isaiah’s mouth was a symbolic act of forgiveness. This action suggests that no painless cure exists for sin. Nevertheless, forgiveness came from God, not from the burning coal. Only God can forgive sin.

Vs 8 Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying: “Whom shall I send, And who will go for ﻿ ﻿Us?” Then I said, “Here am I! Send me.” How could he keep this experience to himself? I believe that even before the Lord asked who would go for them (Us), Isaiah was ready. HE SAW THE LORD, THEN HE SAW HIMSELF, THEN SAW THE NEED AND ANSWERED TO THE CALL.

How can we therefore tell people HOW to be saved before we tell them WHY they need to be saved? For them to see the Lord, we have to take them through the moral law, God reveals Himself in the spirituality of His law. That is where His righteousness and perfect purity of character are revealed for men to learn it there. When they cry out “I’m undone then we give them grace. Why tell a sinner “God loves them and has a wonderful plan for their lives” when in actuality God is angry with sinners daily?. Are we not supposed to be witnesses? Meaning we share what we have seen, heard and experienced? Why try to change the message unless we have not experienced it ourselves or ignorant of it.

Those who have such an experience will have a new appreciation for grace. We sing Amazing grace and so are the lost and many times it appears to both sides as just another hymn with nice melody. How about we revisit the lyrics and bring us back to what it meant to be in sin and appreciate the words more and then turn and show sinners who God is. When they see who God is in His laws, they will see themselves in themselves undone and in need of a Savior and when they have been converted, they too will answer to the call. Let us to cry out to God for passion and compassion then respond to His call. If you are lukewarm, may an Isaiah’s experience awaken you. I challenge you to pray then get up, get out and this month witness to at least ONE lost soul as a start if you are not already sharing. Let’s redeem the time for the days are evil. “Here am I! Send me.”

Meditate on the words: Amazing Grace (How sweet the sound), That sav’d a wretch like me! I once was lost, but now am found, Was blind, but now I see. ‘Twas grace that taught my heart to fear, And grace my fears reliev’d; How precious did that grace appear, The hour I first believ’d. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Here am I Send me, Part 2

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Isaiah 6:, vs. 8 Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying: “Whom shall I send, And who will go or Us?” Then I said, “Here am I! Send me.”

In preparation for calling Isaiah to be the prophet who would proclaim the coming judgment, God gave him a vision of His majestic holiness so overwhelming that it devastated him and made him realize his own sinfulness.

Vs, 4 And the posts of the door were shaken by the voice of him who cried out, and the house was filled with smoke. 5 So I said: “Woe is me, for I am undone! Because I am a man of unclean lips …” It’s interesting to read that Isaiah did not have a warm fussy feeling about a loving gentle God even though God is loving and gentle. He saw the posts of the door shaken by the voice that terrified him, but nothing terrified him, I believe, like His sin made clear by the holiness of God. Think of it this way, you are dusting your table in the morning, it appears very clean after you dust it, then you open the windows for the early morning sunlight to come in. To your horror, you see dust on the table you just cleaned, and you see dust in the air. Would you say the light created dust? Of course not, the light merely exposed what the natural eyes could not see. Isaiah’s experience was like the Lord pulled the curtain of the holy of holies  and he saw the sin (dust) in his life.

Have we see our deep sins to cry “Woe is me, for I am undone! Because I am a man of unclean lips”? The question we need to ask ourselves is, is sin a disease or a crime? Most of us may consider sin as a disease, God considers it a crime. Would you call yourself wretched (meaning a person of great hardship, deprivation, and hopelessness)? Many believers believe they are sinners but have never had the curtains of the holy of holies pulled back to show them their deepest darkness so that they can see how wretched they are. We sing it in the hymn Amazing grace in the line “… that saved a Wretch like me“, easy to sing what we don’t mean/understand. These are the things that wake us up to our condition and especially to the condition of the ungodly. If we found ourselves hopeless having seen our sins with no way of escape until God saved us, how can we assume and be comfortable that the lost will find away out unless we become the witness of what we have seen and experienced? Woe is me, I’m a man of unclean lips Isaiah says, vs. 5, “…And I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips; For my eyes have seen the King, The LORD of hosts. Here is a man who was shown his condition and  instead of looking at others first, he decides to start with himself and right there and then begins to think about the fate of those who are just like him. Having seen the King, the Lord of hosts and did not die shows how the goodness of God preserved him.

At this point he is not only concerned for himself, he is also concerned for the people around him. 2 Corinthians 5:11, “Knowing, therefore, the terror of the Lord, we persuade men;” Isaiah’s vision made him painfully aware of his sin and broke him, in this way God would prepare him for his cleansing and his commission. If we are convinced by our own thoughts that God is all loving and will accept everyone, there would be no drive to change and be used. When we learn the terror of the Lord from our own experience with the Lord, it will ignite something in us to hunger for cleansing and have a deep desire and passion to warn those who are lost and bring them to the saving knowledge and grace of Jesus Christ. I am undone, because I, Evans am a man of unclean lips, may the Lord continue to awaken me and others. To finish blessings Ev evipooh@gmail.com

title.rendered: Here I Am Send Me, Part 1

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Isaiah 6:, vs. 8 Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying: ” Whom shall I send, And who will go or Us?” Then I said, “Here am I! Send me.”

Isaiah 6 is one of my favorite passages. In the early chapters of the book of Isaiah, we see him having a vision from the Lord concerning the wickedness of Judah. He goes into lengthy detail to address its condition based on the vision. He talks about the future house of God, the day of the Lord, judgment on Judah and Jerusalem, oppression, the renewal of Zion and then in chapter 6 we see dramatic experience that changes him forever.

Isaiah may have felt fine and comfortable until he had an experience with God, he says in vs. 11 In the year that King Uzziah died, I saw the Lord sitting on a throne, high and lifted up, and the train of His robe filled the temple. 2 Above it stood seraphim; … 3 And one cried to another and said: ” Holy, holy, holy is the LORD of hosts;” The whole earth is full of His glory!”. In looking at the world, we have lost the fear of the Lord. This has crept even in the body of Christ. It’s now easy to have a form of godliness but deny the power 2Tim 3:5. Everything is normal, we come to church, we sing songs, we pray, we hear the word, we are involved in ministries but have we had an experience that awakens us to HUNGER for more?. How can we be hungry when we feel full by what we do day to day. Isaiah had seen the state of his people, the question is, was he hungry enough for God to move in his life and use him to reach his people? Not until he had an experience that messed his comfort. When we see the Lord sitting on the throne, high and lifted up, Righteousness and justice as foundation of His throne Psalm 97:2, Psalm 89:14 and we see how Holy He is and we are convinced, “.. we are all like an unclean thing, And all our righteousnesses are like filthy rags; We all fade as a leaf, And our iniquities, like the wind, Have taken us away”, Isaiah 64:6, we will not be ready for change. We need a hunger that drives us to change and that change will motivate us to be concerned for the lost sinners to reach them with the gospel. Reaching the lost is not reserved for certain people, it’s for every believer. Those who act upon it are the ones who are hungry with passion and compassion.

In the state of our world today as Pastor John Piper preaches, “The glory of God is not honored, The holiness of God is not reverenced, The greatness of God is not admired, The power of God is not praised, The truth of God is not sought, The wisdom of God is not esteemed, The beauty of God is not treasured, The goodness of God is not savored, The faithfulness of God is not trusted, The promises of God are not relied upon, The commandments of God are not obeyed, The justice of God is not respected, The wrath of God is not feared, The grace of God is not cherished, The presence of God is not prized, The person of God is not loved”, oh how these words would drive us to hunger for an Isaiah’s experience.

As a believer, having been saved, what experience in your life have you had that altered, challenged and awakened you to respond to the call of God? 5 years after I was saved, the thought of going to heaven consumed my mind. Felt like I had secured a place for myself and I was very comfortable being saved. I didn’t want do anything more, after all I was already rescued from hell. It was not until I had my own Isaiah’s experience while praying that awakened me and put a hunger in me for more. The more I saw the glory of God, the righteousness of God, the holiness of God etc, the more I saw I was undone and the world I live in was in danger, in need of the gospel. I saw myself as one of the vessels to be used to bring them out of their own self righteousness to God’s righteousness. That they would have their own Isaiah’s experience that would alter their lives forever too. Romans 10:3, “For they being ignorant of God’s righteousness, and seeking to establish their own righteousness, have not submitted to the righteousness of God“, without the righteousness of God, they will perish. to continue, blessings Ev

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Kings 5:, vs. 20, “Gehazi, the servant of Elisha the man of God, said to himself, “My master was too easy on Naaman, this Aramean, by not accepting from him what he brought. As surely as the LORD lives, I will run after him and get something from him.” (NIV)

Let’s see how Gehazi’s untamed passion destroyed his life. The first mistake he made, he desired what his master let go and ran after Namaan to get something for himself. Two, he lied on his master the Prophet, vs. 22, “And he said, “All is well. My master has sent me, saying, ‘Indeed, just now two young men of the sons of the prophets have come to me from the mountains of Ephraim. Please give them a talent of silver and two changes of garments.” To use someone’s name to get things or get a head is deadly, it tarnishes your reputation and integrity, also opens doors to destroy other peoples’ lives. Who wants to work with a big liar?

Naaman gives him as much as he asks for, he takes and hides them. No shame in his part after all he has everything he wanted, what he was passionate about and what he opened himself to get. Three, upon asked where he had been by his master the prophet, he chose to lie to him too vs. 25 … Elisha said to him, “Where did you go, Gehazi?” And he said, “Your servant did not go anywhere.” He was trying by all means to cover his tracks not remembering that he is dealing with a prophet who God had used to see what was happening in a king’s camp, who saw things beyond the natural eyes. Elisha says, vs. 26″…Did not my heart go with you when the man turned back from his chariot to meet you? What if he came clean, we don’t know whether Elisha may have chosen to forgive him. The bible says in Proverbs 28:13, “He who covers his sins will not prosper, But whoever confesses and forsakes them will have mercy”.

Vs 26″… Is it time to receive money and to receive clothing, olive groves and vineyards, sheep and oxen, male and female servants? “Is it time” shows me that there was time to receive, time to be blessed, this was not the time and the way to get it. The desires of his heart brought about Elisha’s curse upon him, vs. 27 Therefore the leprosy of Naaman shall cling to you and your descendants forever.” And he went out from his presence leprous, as white as snow”, Instead of getting gifts Naaman brought with him, he got the sickness Naaman got healed of. I wonder whether he wished at this point Naaman never came. This is why we always need to remember Genesis 4:7, “…sin is crouching at your door; it desires to have you, but you must master it” The enemy knows what we respond to well.

The love of money is the root of all evil, was at the bottom of Gehazi’s sin. He thought to impose upon the prophet, but soon found that the Spirit of prophecy could not be deceived, and that it was in vain to lie to the Holy Ghost. What you crave for is what you will be opened to pursue. While the world craves for happiness and pursues it, we as believers ought to pursue righteousness. Paul in his life had things he pursued which were assets to him but when Christ met him, all his assets he characterized as liabilities. There was nothing as fulfilling as living for Christ., Philippians 3: 7 But what things were gain to me, these I have counted loss for Christ. 8 Yet indeed I also count all things loss for the excellence of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and count them as rubbish, that I may gain Christ“, the more he pursued Christ, the more he was content. One act of untamed passions destroyed Gehazi, his health, his family, his reputation, tainted his character, his ministry, his destiny. Let us beware of hypocrisy and covetousness, and dread the curse of spiritual leprosy remaining on our souls.. Blessings Ev, evipooh@gmail.com

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2Kings 5:, vs. 20, “Gehazi, the servant of Elisha the man of God, said to himself, “My master was too easy on Naaman, this Aramean, by not accepting from him what he brought. As surely as the LORD lives, I will run after him and get something from him.” (NIV)

One of the things that has drowned the economy is greed, an excessive desire to acquire or possess more than what one needs or deserves, especially with respect to material wealth (possession) and there are believers who got caught up in the same things.

Elisha was one time a very faithful servant of Elijah. After Elijah was taken to heaven, Elisha became the next prophet and he too had a servant by the name of Gehazi. Gehazi was instrumental in Elisha’s ministry. We see him play an important role in identifying how the Shunammite woman in 2kings 4 could be blessed with a child for her generosity. Who knows whether Gehazi was also being prepped to take Elisha’s position when he was gone. Prophets would receive gifts for their ministry and their servants I believe were also part of the gifts as they served. In this episode, Naaman, a commander in the army of Assyria comes to Elisha to be healed of his leprosy. Vs 5, “…So Naaman started out, carrying as gifts 750 pounds of silver, 150 pounds of gold, and ten sets of clothing” (NLT). This man came fully loaded, with the best and greatest gift a prophet would have ever received. He is sent to the river Jordan to deep himself seven times; he fights it and then reluctantly agrees to it. Long story short, he comes back rejoicing having been healed of leprosy. He then says, vs. 15 “…Now I know that there is no God in all the world except in Israel. So please accept a gift from your servant.” And Elisha would not receive the gift though it was customary for Prophets to receive such gifts. In our day today how many including preachers would have sent this man back with his gift? I choose to believe the reason for not accepting the gift was to show that the miracles of God are free and cannot be bought, as a result he was humbled and changed. For the first time he was worshiping the true God. Vs 17, “Then Naaman said, “All right, but please allow me to load two of my mules with earth from this place, and I will take it back home with me. From now on I will never again offer burnt offerings or sacrifices to any other god except the Lord”.

Vs 20, “Gehazi, the servant of Elisha the man of God, said to himself, “My master was too easy on Naaman, this Aramean, by not accepting from him what he brought. As surely as the LORD lives, I will run after him and get something from him.” (NIV)” Gehazi sees a lost opportunity to receive the gifts he may have been eyeing. He may have worked hard to help Naaman because there was a reward in the end of it. Instead of rejoicing with Naaman and standing by his masters who chose to let go, he goes after Naaman behind Elisha’s back. Passions and greed rise up reminding us of the time Cain became angry with his brother Abel over their sacrifices to the Lord. Abel’s was received, Cain’s was rejected and the Lord said to Cain, Genesis 4:7, “If you do what is right, will you not be accepted? But if you do not do what is right, sin is crouching at your door; it desires to have you, but you must master it.” The sin of greed was crouching at Gehazi’s door but instead of mastering it, he yielded to it. This opened doors to what we will look at. Untamed passions takes a person off the Lord’s will, sets them up for disaster. It’s sin waiting to devour and must be mastered and none of us is not tempted with greed be it in small or large scale. Blessings Ev, evipooh@gmail.com
